135//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
137
138#define _TX_VER _TX_v_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 171, 2021-07-19 01:45:49 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
139#define _TX_VERSION _TX_V_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 171, 2021-07-19 01:45:49 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
140#define _TX_AUTHOR _TX_A_FROM_CVS ($VersionInfo: , TXLib.h, 00173a, 171, 2021-07-19 01:45:49 +0400, "Ded (Ilya Dedinsky, http://txlib.ru) <mail@txlib.ru>", $)
141
143#define _TX_v_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2) ((0x##ver##u << 16) | 0x##rev##u)
144#define _TX_V_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2) "TXLib [Ver: " #ver ", Rev: " #rev ", Date: " #date "]"
145#define _TX_A_FROM_CVS(_1,file,ver,rev,date,auth,_2) "Copyright (C) " auth

159 #define _TX_MODULE "TXLib"
160#endif

162//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
166//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
167
168#if defined (__GNUC__)
169
170 #define _GCC_VER ( __GNUC__*100 + __GNUC_MINOR__*10 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__ )
171
172 #define __TX_COMPILER__ "GNU g++ " TX_QUOTE (__GNUC__) "." \
173 TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_MINOR__) "." \
174 TX_QUOTE (__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) \
175 ", std=" TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
176
177#elif defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
178
179 #define _CLANG_VER ( __clang_major__*100 + __clang_minor__*10 + __clang_patchlevel__ )
180
181 #define __TX_COMPILER__ "Clang " TX_QUOTE (__clang_major__) "." \
182 TX_QUOTE (__clang_minor__) "." \
183 TX_QUOTE (__clang_patchlevel__) \
184 ", std=" TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
185#elif defined (_MSC_VER)
186
187 #define __TX_COMPILER__ "MSVS " TX_QUOTE (_MSC_VER) \
188 ", std=" TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
189
190#elif defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
191
192 #define __TX_COMPILER__ "Intel C++ " TX_QUOTE (__INTEL_COMPILER) \
193 ", std=" TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
194#else
195
196 #define __TX_COMPILER__ "Unknown C++, std=" TX_QUOTE (__cplusplus)
197 #endif
198
200
201#define TX_QUOTE(sym) _TX_QUOTE (sym)
202#define _TX_QUOTE(sym) #sym
203
204#define TX_JOIN(sym1, sym2) _TX_JOIN (sym1, sym2)
205#define _TX_JOIN(sym1, sym2) sym1 ## sym2
206
208
209#if (__cplusplus >= 201103L) || defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1800) // MSVC 2013
210
211 #define _TX_CPP11 1
212 #endif
213
214#if (__cplusplus >= 201103L) || defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1900) // MSVC 2015
215
216 #define _TX_CPP11_MSVC15 1
217 #endif
218
219//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
223//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
224
225#if !defined (NDEBUG) && defined (_DEBUG)
226 #define _TX_BUILDMODE "DEBUG"
227
228#elif !defined (NDEBUG) && !defined (_DEBUG)
229 #define _TX_BUILDMODE "Debug"
230
231#elif defined (NDEBUG)
232 #define _TX_BUILDMODE "Release"
233#endif
234
235//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
239//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
240
241#define __TX_FILELINE__ __FILE__ " (" TX_QUOTE (__LINE__) ")"
242
243//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
251//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
252
253#if defined (__GNUC__) || defined (__clang__) || defined (__clang_major__)
254 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __PRETTY_FUNCTION__
255
256#elif defined (__FUNCSIG__)
257 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __FUNCSIG__
258
259#elif defined (__FUNCTION__)
260 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __FUNCTION__
261
262#elif defined (__INTEL_COMPILER) && (__INTEL_COMPILER >= 600)
263 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __FUNCTION__
264
265#elif defined (__BORLANDC__) && (__BORLANDC__ >= 0x550)
266 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __FUNC__
267
268#elif defined (__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 199711L)
269 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __func__
270
271#elif defined (__STDC_VERSION__) && (__STDC_VERSION__ >= 199901L)
272 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ __func__
273
274#elif defined (__PYTHON__)
275 #error No Python. No. Using parseltongue languages can lead you to Slytherin.
276
277#else
278 #define __TX_FUNCTION__ "(" __TX_FILELINE__ ")"
279
280#endif
281
282#if !defined (__func__) && defined (__FUNCTION__)
283 #define __func__ __FUNCTION__
284
285#endif
286
287//}
288//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
289

291//{ Compiler- and platform-specific
293//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
295
296#if !defined (__cplusplus)
297
298 #ifdef __GNUC__
299 #error
300 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
301 #endif
302 #error TXLib.h: Must use C++ to compile TXLib.h. Now you are using C only.
303 #error
304 #error CHECK source file EXTENSION. Maybe it is ".C". It must be ".CPP".
305 #error If your file is named, for example, "Untitled.C", go to menu [File],
306 #error then [Save As] and rename it to "Untitled.CPP". Please do NOT use spaces.
307 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
308 #error
309
310#endif
311
312//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
313
314#if !defined (WIN32) && !defined (__WIN32__) && !defined(_WIN32) && !defined(_WIN32_WINNT) && !defined (__CYGWIN__)
315
316 #ifdef __GNUC__
317 #error
318 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
319 #endif
320 #error TXLib.h: Windows (MSVC/Win32 or GCC/MinGW or Cygwin) is the only supported OS, sorry.
321 #error
322 #error In Linux or MacOS, you should write your own TXLib and share it with your friends, or use wine.
323 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
324 #error
325
326#endif

330#if defined (UNICODE) || defined (_UNICODE)
331
332 #ifdef __GNUC__
333 #warning TXLib.h: Disabling the UNICODE
334 #endif
335
336 #undef UNICODE // Burn Unicode, burn
337 #undef _UNICODE
338
339 #if defined (_WINDOWS_H) || defined (_INC_WINDOWS) || defined (_WINDOWS_) || defined (__WINDOWS__)
340
341 #ifdef __GNUC__
342 #error
343 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
344 #endif
345 #error TXLib.h: Should include "TXLib.h" BEFORE or INSTEAD of <Windows.h> in UNICODE mode.
346 #error
347 #error REARRANGE your #include directives, or DISABLE the UNICODE mode by #undef UNICODE/_UNICODE.
348 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
349 #error
350
351 #endif
352
353#endif

363
364 #ifdef __GNUC__
365 #error
366 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
367 #endif
368 #error TXLib.h: Should include "TXLib.h" BEFORE <string.h> or <stdio.h> in Strict ANSI mode.
369 #error
370 #error REARRANGE your #include directives, or DISABLE ANSI-compliancy by #undef __STRICT_ANSI__.
371 #error ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
372 #error
373
374 #endif

376#endif

494 #define _tx_thread __thread
495 #define _tx_decltype(value) __decltype (value)
496
497 #define _FORTIFY_SOURCE 2

499 #ifndef MINGW_HAS_SECURE_API
500 #define MINGW_HAS_SECURE_API 1
501 #endif

503 #if defined (TX_USE_SFML)
504 #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
505 #endif
506
507 #ifndef _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG // TXLib enables _GLIBCXX_DEBUG by default. When using third-party libraries
508 #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG // compiled without _GLIBCXX_DEBUG (SFML, for example), #define _GLIBCXX_NDEBUG
509 #define _GLIBCXX_DEBUG_PEDANTIC // *before* including TXLib.h.
510 #endif
511
512 #if defined (_WIN64) // removed in x86 because printf ("%lg", double) failure, this prints 0 always
513 #ifndef __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO
514 #define __USE_MINGW_ANSI_STDIO 1
515 #endif
516 #endif
517
518 template <typename T>
519 inline T _txNOP (T value) { return value; } // To suppress performance warnings in assert etc.
520
521 // From MinGW\include\float.h which is replaced by MinGW\lib\gcc\i686-pc-mingw32\x.x.x\include\float.h
522 extern "C" __declspec (dllimport) unsigned __cdecl _controlfp (unsigned control, unsigned mask);
523 extern "C" void __cdecl _fpreset ();
524
525#else
526
527 #define __attribute__( attr )
528 #define _txNOP( value ) ( value )
529
530#endif

620#if defined (_MSC_VER)
621
622 #pragma warning (push, 4) // Set maximum warning level. This 'push' is to set the level only. It will NOT be popped.
623
624 #pragma warning (disable: 4616) // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
625
626 #pragma warning (disable: 4514) // Unreferenced inline function has been removed
627 #pragma warning (disable: 4710) // Function not inlined
628 #pragma warning (disable: 4786) // Identifier was truncated to '255' characters in the debug information
629
630 #pragma warning (error: 4715) // Not all control paths return a value
631
632 #pragma warning (default: 4616) // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning //-V665
633
634 // These warning settings for TXLib.h only and will be re-enabled at end of file:
635
636 #pragma warning (push)
637
638 #pragma warning (disable: 4616) // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning
639
640 #pragma warning (disable: 4091) // 'typedef': ignored on left of '...' when no variable is declared
641 #pragma warning (disable: 4124) // Using __fastcall with stack checking is ineffective
642 #pragma warning (disable: 4127) // Conditional expression is constant
643 #pragma warning (disable: 4200) // Nonstandard extension used: zero-sized array in struct/union
644 #pragma warning (disable: 4201) // Nonstandard extension used: nameless struct/union
645 #pragma warning (disable: 4351) // New behavior: elements of array will be default initialized
646 #pragma warning (disable: 4480) // Nonstandard extension used: specifying underlying type for enum 'type'
647 #pragma warning (disable: 4481) // Nonstandard extension used: override specifier 'override'
648 #pragma warning (disable: 4555) // Result of expression not used
649 #pragma warning (disable: 4611) // Interaction between '_setjmp' and C++ object destruction is non-portable
650 #pragma warning (disable: 5045) // Compiler will insert Spectre mitigation for memory load if /Qspectre switch specified
651 #pragma warning (disable: 6269) // Possibly incorrect order of operations: dereference ignored
652 #pragma warning (disable: 6285) // (<non-zero constant>) || (<non-zero constant>) is always a non-zero constant. Did you intend to use bitwize-and operator?
653 #pragma warning (disable: 6319) // Use of the comma-operator in a tested expression causes the left argument to be ignored when it has no side-effects
654 #pragma warning (disable: 6326) // Potential comparison of a constant with another constant
655 #pragma warning (disable: 26135) // Missing locking annotation
656 #pragma warning (disable: 26400) // Do not assign the result of an allocation or a function call with an owner<T> return value to a raw pointer, use owner<T> instead (i.11).
657 #pragma warning (disable: 26401) // Do not delete a raw pointer that is not an owner<T> (i.11).
658 #pragma warning (disable: 26403) // Reset or explicitly delete an owner<T> pointer 'name' (r.3).
659 #pragma warning (disable: 26408) // Avoid malloc() and free(), prefer the nothrow version of new with delete (r.10).
660 #pragma warning (disable: 26409) // Avoid calling new and delete explicitly, use std::make_unique<T> instead (r.11).
661 #pragma warning (disable: 26426) // Global initializer calls a non-constexpr function 'name' (i.22).
662 #pragma warning (disable: 26429) // Symbol 'name' is never tested for nullness, it can be marked as not_null (f.23).
663 #pragma warning (disable: 26430) // Symbol 'name' is not tested for nullness on all paths (f.23).
664 #pragma warning (disable: 26432) // If you define or delete any default operation in the type 'struct 'name'', define or delete them all (c.21).
665 #pragma warning (disable: 26435) // Function 'name' should specify exactly one of 'virtual', 'override', or 'final' (c.128).
666 #pragma warning (disable: 26438) // Avoid 'goto' (es.76).
667 #pragma warning (disable: 26440) // Function 'name' can be declared 'noexcept' (f.6).
668 #pragma warning (disable: 26446) // Prefer to use gsl::at() instead of unchecked subscript operator (bounds.4).
669 #pragma warning (disable: 26447) // The function is declared 'noexcept' but calls function 'func' which may throw exceptions (f.6).
670 #pragma warning (disable: 26448) // Consider using gsl::finally if final action is intended (gsl.util).
671 #pragma warning (disable: 26451) // Arithmetic overflow: Using operator 'op' on a n-byte value and then casting the result to a m-byte value. Cast the value to the wider type before calling operator 'op' to avoid overflow (io.2).
672 #pragma warning (disable: 26455) // Default constructor may not throw. Declare it 'noexcept' (f.6).
673 #pragma warning (disable: 26457) // (void) should not be used to ignore return values, use 'std::ignore =' instead (es.48)
674 #pragma warning (disable: 26460) // The reference argument 'stream' for function 'name' can be marked as const (con.3).
675 #pragma warning (disable: 26461) // The pointer argument 'name' for function 'name' can be marked as a pointer to const (con.3).
676 #pragma warning (disable: 26462) // The value pointed to by 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as a pointer to const (con.4).
677 #pragma warning (disable: 26475) // Do not use function style C-casts (es.49).
678 #pragma warning (disable: 26477) // Use 'nullptr' rather than 0 or NULL (es.47).
679 #pragma warning (disable: 26481) // Don't use pointer arithmetic. Use span instead (bounds.1).
680 #pragma warning (disable: 26482) // Only index into arrays using constant expressions (bounds.2).
681 #pragma warning (disable: 26483) // Value 'value' is outside the bounds (min, max) of variable 'name'. Only index into arrays using constant expressions that are within bounds of the array (bounds.2).
682 #pragma warning (disable: 26485) // Expression 'expr': No array to pointer decay (bounds.3).
683 #pragma warning (disable: 26486) // Don't pass a pointer that may be invalid to a function. Parameter 'n' 'name' in call to 'name' may be invalid (lifetime.3).
684 #pragma warning (disable: 26487) // Don't return a pointer 'name' that may be invalid (lifetime.4).
685 #pragma warning (disable: 26488) // Do not dereference a potentially null pointer: 'name'. 'name' was null at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
686 #pragma warning (disable: 26489) // Don't dereference a pointer that may be invalid: 'name'. 'name' may have been invalidated at line 'n' (lifetime.1).
687 #pragma warning (disable: 26490) // Don't use reinterpret_cast (type.1).
688 #pragma warning (disable: 26492) // Don't use const_cast to cast away const or volatile (type.3).
689 #pragma warning (disable: 26493) // Don't use C-style casts (type.4).
690 #pragma warning (disable: 26496) // The variable 'name' is assigned only once, mark it as const (con.4).
691 #pragma warning (disable: 26497) // The function 'name' could be marked constexpr if compile-time evaluation is desired (f.4).
692 #pragma warning (disable: 26812) // The enum type 'type' is unscoped. Prefer 'enum class' over 'enum' (Enum.3).
693 #pragma warning (disable: 26814) // The const variable 'name' can be computed at compile-time. Consider using constexpr (con.5).
694 #pragma warning (disable: 28125) // The function must be called from within a try/except block
695 #pragma warning (disable: 28159) // Consider using another function instead
696
697 #pragma warning (default: 4616) // #pragma warning: warning number 'n' not a valid compiler warning //-V665
698
699 #define _tx_thread __declspec (thread)
700 #define _tx_decltype(value) decltype (value)
701
702 #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
703
704 #pragma setlocale ("russian") // Set source file encoding, see also _TX_CODEPAGE
705
706 #if !defined (NDEBUG)
707 #pragma check_stack ( on) // Turn on stack probes at runtime
708 #pragma strict_gs_check (push, on) // Detects stack buffer overruns
709 #endif
710
711 #endif
712
713 #define _CRT_SECURE_CPP_OVERLOAD_SECURE_NAMES 1
714
715#endif
716

719#if defined (__INTEL_COMPILER)
720
721 #pragma warning (disable: 174) // Remark: expression has no effect
722 #pragma warning (disable: 304) // Remark: access control not specified ("public" by default)
723 #pragma warning (disable: 444) // Remark: destructor for base class "..." is not virtual
724 #pragma warning (disable: 522) // Remark: function "..." redeclared "inline" after being called
725 #pragma warning (disable: 981) // Remark: operands are evaluated in unspecified order
726 #pragma warning (disable: 1684) // Conversion from pointer to same-sized integral type (potential portability problem)
727
728#endif

733 defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER < 1600)) // Minimum requirements are now GCC 4.7.2 or MSVC 10.0 (2010)

755 #endif

757 #error

759 #error nesessary for txSpeak() to work.

771#endif // they are allowed by default if WINVER >= 0x0600.

791
792#define _ALLOW_RTCc_IN_STL 1 // MSVC C2338: /RTCc rejects conformant code, so it isn't supported by libc.
793
794#define NOMINMAX 1 // Preventing 'min' and 'max' defines in Windows.h
795

798#define _HAS_ITERATOR_DEBUGGING 1
799#define _LIBCPP_DEBUG 1
800#endif

900#if !defined (_TRUNCATE) || defined (__CYGWIN__) || defined (_MEMORY_S_DEFINED)
901
902 #define strncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count ) ( strncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
903 #define wcsncpy_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count ) ( wcsncpy ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
904 #define strncat_s( dest, sizeof_dest, src, count ) ( strncat ((dest), (src), MIN ((count), (sizeof_dest))) )
905 #define strerror_s( buf, sizeof_buf, code ) ( strncpy ((buf), strerror ((int)(code)), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
906 #define strtok_s( buf, delim, ctx ) ( (void)(ctx), strtok ((buf), (delim)) )
907 #define fopen_s( file, name, mode ) ( *(file) = fopen ((name), (mode)) )
908 #define _strlwr_s( str, sizeof_str ) ( _strlwr (str) )
909
910 #define ctime_s( buf, sizeof_buf, time ) ( strncpy ((buf), ctime (time), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
911 #define _controlfp_s( oldCtl, newCtl, mask ) ( assert (oldCtl), *(oldCtl) = _controlfp (newCtl, mask), 0 )
912
913 #define _snprintf_s snprintf
914 #define _vsnprintf_s( str, sz, trunc, format, arg ) _vsnprintf (str, sz, format, arg)
915
916#endif
917
918#if !( defined (_MSC_VER) || defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__) )
919
920 #define getenv_s( sz, buf, sizeof_buf, name ) ( (void)(sz), strncpy ((buf), getenv (name), (sizeof_buf)-1) )
921
922#endif

1441
1442const COLORREF
1443#ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
1444 enum txColors {
1445#endif
1446
1447 TX_BLACK = RGB ( 0, 0, 0),
1448 TX_BLUE = RGB ( 0, 0, 128),
1449 TX_GREEN = RGB ( 0, 128, 0),
1450 TX_CYAN = RGB ( 0, 128, 128),
1451 TX_RED = RGB (128, 0, 0),
1452 TX_MAGENTA = RGB (128, 0, 128),
1453 TX_BROWN = RGB (128, 128, 0),
1454 TX_ORANGE = RGB (255, 128, 0),
1455 TX_GRAY = RGB (160, 160, 160),
1456 TX_DARKGRAY = RGB (128, 128, 128),
1457 TX_LIGHTGRAY = RGB (192, 192, 192),
1458 TX_LIGHTBLUE = RGB ( 0, 0, 255),
1459 TX_LIGHTGREEN = RGB ( 0, 255, 128),
1460 TX_LIGHTCYAN = RGB ( 0, 255, 255),
1461 TX_LIGHTRED = RGB (255, 0, 128),
1462 TX_LIGHTMAGENTA = RGB (255, 0, 255),
1463 TX_PINK = RGB (255, 128, 255),
1464 TX_YELLOW = RGB (255, 255, 128),
1465 TX_WHITE = RGB (255, 255, 255),
1466 TX_TRANSPARENT = 0xFFFFFFFF,
1467 TX_NULL = TX_TRANSPARENT,
1468 TX_BLM = TX_BLACK,
1469 TX_white = TX_WHITE,
1470
1471// Цветовые каналы (компоненты) -- см. txExtractColor(), txRGB2HSL(), txHSL2RGB()
1472
1473 TX_HUE = 0x04000000,
1474 TX_SATURATION = 0x05000000,
1475 TX_LIGHTNESS = 0x06000000;
1476
1477#ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
1478 };
1479#endif
1480
1482#define TX_GREY TX_GRAY
1483#define TX_DARKGREY TX_DARKGRAY
1484#define TX_LIGHTGREY TX_LIGHTGRAY

2058//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2076//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2077
2078inline bool txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
2079 {
2080 (void)x1; (void)y1; (void)x2; (void)y2; (void)x3; (void)y3;
2081
2082 txMessageBox ("txTriangle (double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)\n\n"
2083 "Эта функция не реализована в библиотеке, потому что вы легко можете реализовать ее сами "
2084 "как функцию с параметрами, используя txPolygon(). См. \"Пример с функциями с параметрами\". "
2085 "Ну или нарисовать тремя линиями. :)", "TXLib сообщает");
2086 return false;
2087 }
2088
2089//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2091
2092bool txNotifyIcon (unsigned flags, const char title[], const char format[], ...) tx_printfy (3);
2093
2094#define txRectandle Sleep (1000), txRectangle // Copy-protection for the function below
2095#define txLine(...) txLine (__VA_ARGS__); { //
2096#define txNotifyIcon }}}}}}}}}} txNotifyIcon // Не спрашивайте, зачем. Это дичь.
2097#define txCircle ;txCircle //
2098#define txSetColor ;txSetColor //
2099#define C0L0RREF COLORREF //
2100#define OxFFFFFF 0xFFFFFF //
2101#define lO 10 //
2102#define lOOO 1000 //
2103#define oo //
2104#define O //
2105
2107//}
2108
2109//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2150//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------//////
2151 //
2152inline void txDrawMan (int x, int y, int sizeX, int sizeY, COLORREF color, double handL, double handR, double twist, //
2153 double head, double eyes, double wink, double crazy, double smile, double hair, double wind) //
2154 { //
2155 const char __[] = "\0/А я - человечек из библиотеки!\0/Меня объясняли на уроке!\0/Напиши меня сам!\0/"; //
2156 // | | | | //
2157 // Не копипастите! _/ \_ Все равно не получится! :) _/ \_ Человечки защищают _/ \_ этот код! :) _/ \_ Муаххаха! //
2158 // //
2159 static int count = GetTickCount(), L = 0;
2160
2161 C0L0RREF lineColor = txGetColor();
2162 C0L0RREF fillColor = txGetFillColor();
2163
2164 txSetColor (color, 3);
2165 txSetFillColor (color);
2166
2167 txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x, y - O.7 * sizeY);
2168
2169 txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2.0, y - (O.7 + handL) * sizeY);
2170 txLine (x, y - O.7 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y - (O.7 + handR) * sizeY);
2171
2172 txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x - sizeX/2.0, y);
2173 txLine (x + twist * sizeX, y - O.35 * sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y);
2174
2175 txCircle (x, y - (O.85 + head) * sizeY, O.15 * sizeY);
2176
2177 txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + wind/lO * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
2178 txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO - O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
2179 txLine (x, y - (1 + head) * sizeY, x + (wind/lO + O.1) * sizeX, y - (1 + head + hair/lO) * sizeY);
2180
2181 txSetColor (~color & OxFFFFFF); // Inverse the color
2182 txSetFillColor (~color & OxFFFFFF);
2183
2184 txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
2185 txLine (x, y - (O.8 + head - O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY, x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.8 + head + O.05 * smile/2) * sizeY);
2186 oo
2187 txNotifyIcon (4, (const char*)!! (L+'L')[(__)], "\n%s\n", __ + ((unsigned) (((count -=- 1) ^=! 1) ^=~ ((0)^(0)) +1) % 3)["\x02\"<"]); //-V112 //-V542
2188 oo
2189 // See above: Frog construct [(__)], Mouth operator -=-, Cat operator ^=!, Mouse operator ^=~ and Owl constant ((0)^(0)). Use it freely, meow
2190
2191 txCircle (x - O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head - O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 + O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
2192 txCircle (x + O.05 * sizeY, y - (O.9 + head + O.02 * crazy) * sizeY, eyes * (1 - O.5*wink) * O.02 * sizeY);
2193 Sleep (lOOO + count%2);
2194
2195 txSetColor ((color == 0xDEADFACE)? TX_DARKGRAY : TX_TRANSPARENT);
2196 txSetFillColor (TX_TRANSPARENT);
2197
2198 txCircle (x, y, 4); //-V112
2199 txRectandle (x - sizeX/2.0, y - sizeY, x + sizeX/2.0, y);
2200
2201 txSetColor (lineColor);
2202 txSetFillColor (fillColor);
2203 }
2204
2206//}
2207//=================================================================================================================
2208
2209//=================================================================================================================

2212//=================================================================================================================
2214//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2233//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
2234
2235bool txTextOut (double x, double y, const char text[], HDC dc = txDC());
2236

2247#undef lO

4297//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4369//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4371
4372#define sizearr( arr ) ( sizeof (get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (arr)) )
4373
4375// See explanation here: http://blogs.msdn.com/b/the1/archive/2004/05/07/128242.aspx
4376
4377template <typename T, size_t N> char (&get_size_of_an_array_with_unknown_or_nonconst_size_ (T (&) [N])) [N]; // ;=P
4378
4379// Another approach
4380
4381#if defined (_TX_CPP11_MSVC15)
4382template <typename T, size_t N> constexpr size_t countof (const T (&) [N] ) { return N; }
4383#endif
4384
4386
4387#define SIZEARR( arr ) ( sizeof (arr) / sizeof ((arr)[0]) )
4388

4602
4603 #define ROUND( x ) ( (long) round (x) )
4604
4605#else
4606
4607 #define ROUND( x ) ( (long) floor ((x) + 0.5) )

4634//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4643//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4644
4645const double txPI = asin (1.0) * 2;
4646
4647//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4674//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4675
4676inline double txSqr (double x)
4677 {
4678 double sqr = pow (sqrt (x) * sqrt (x), sqrt (4.0)); // Бурная вычислительная деятельность
4679
4680 char str[1024] = "";
4681 _snprintf_s (str, sizeof (str), "Возведение дало %g!" "!!" "!!" " Вы рады??1!!", sqr);
4682 txMessageBox (str, "Получен ОТВЕТ!" "!!", MB_ICONEXCLAMATION | MB_YESNO) != IDCANCEL ||
4683 (
4684 txMessageBox ("Жаль...", "А я так старалась", MB_ICONINFORMATION),
4685 txMessageBox ("Уйду я от вас", "Злые вы...", MB_ICONSTOP),
4686 exit (EXIT_FAILURE), 0 //-V2509 //-V2014
4687 );
4688
4689 txNotifyIcon (1, NULL, "\n%s\n", "Высшая математика! \0" // А как это работает, а? //-V111
4690 "С ума сойти... \0" //
4691 "а КЭП подтверждает \0" // и кто это будет
4692 "Главное - отчитаться\0" // поддерживать?..
4693 "Невероятно, но факт \0"
4694 "Кто бы мог подумать?\0" + GetTickCount() % 6 * 21);
4695
4696 return sqr; // Все же вернем значение. Мы же не звери
4697 }
4698

4782
4783#define ZERO( type ) zero <type> ()

4788
4789//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4816//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4818
4819#define tx_auto_func( func ) _tx_auto_fun1 ( __LINE__, func )
4820#define _tx_auto_fun1( n, func ) _tx_auto_fun2 ( n, func )
4821#define _tx_auto_fun2( n, func ) auto _tx_auto_func_##n = _tx_auto_func ([&]() { func; })
4822
4823#define tx_finally(...) tx_auto_func (__VA_ARGS__)
4824
4825template <typename T>
4826struct _tx_auto_func_
4827 {
4828 typedef _tx_auto_func_<T> this_t;
4829 T func_;
4830
4831 explicit _tx_auto_func_ (T func) : func_ (func) {}
4832 ~_tx_auto_func_ () { func_ (); }
4833
4834 private: _tx_auto_func_ () _tx_delete;
4835 _tx_auto_func_ (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
4836 this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
4837 };
4838
4839template <typename T>
4840_tx_auto_func_<T> _tx_auto_func (T func)
4841 {
4842 return _tx_auto_func_ <T> (func);
4843 }
4844
4846
4847//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4892//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4893
4894#if !defined (NDEBUG)
4895 #undef TX_ASSERT
4896 #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) _txNOP ( !(cond)? (TX_ERROR ("\a" "ВНЕЗАПНО: Логическая ошибка: " \
4897 "Неверно, что \"%s\"." TX_COMMA #cond), 1/(int)!!(cond)) : 1 )
4898#else
4899 #undef TX_ASSERT
4900 #define TX_ASSERT( cond ) ((void) 1)
4901
4902#endif
4903
4904#ifdef assert
4905 #undef assert
4906#endif
4907
4908#define assert( cond ) TX_ASSERT (cond)
4909
4910//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4937//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4938
4939#if !defined (NDEBUG)
4940 #define asserted || TX_ERROR ("\a" "Обнаружен нулевой или ложный результат.")
4941
4942#else
4943 #define asserted || _txNOP (0)
4944
4945#endif
4946
4947#define verified asserted
4948
4950#define TX_NEEDED asserted
4952
4953//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4981//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
4982
4983#if !defined (NDEBUG)
4984 #undef verify
4985 #define verify assert
4986
4987#else
4988 #undef verify
4989 #define verify( expr ) ( expr )
4990
4991#endif
4992
4993//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5012//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5013
5014#if !defined (FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY)
5015 #define TX_ERROR( ... ) ::TX::_txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
5016#else
5017 #define TX_ERROR( msg ) ::TX::_txError (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__, 0, msg)
5018#endif
5019
5021 #define TX_THROW TX_ERROR
5023
5024//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5040//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
5041
5042#if !defined (NDEBUG)
5043 #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...) TX_ERROR (__VA_ARGS__)
5044
5045#else
5046 #define TX_DEBUG_ERROR(...) ((void) 0)
5047
5048#endif

5074#endif

5077
5078#ifdef _MSC_VER
5079#define txDump( ... ) _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) __VA_ARGS__)
5080#else
5081#define txDump( address, ... ) _txDump ((const void*)(uintptr_t) (address), #address, ##__VA_ARGS__)
5082#endif
5083
5084void _txDump (const void* address, const char name[] = "_txDump()", bool pause = true);

5261
5262#ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
5263
5264 #define TX_DLLIMPORT( required, libName, retValType, funcName, funcParams, callType )
5265
5266#else
5267
5268 // Hand-made DLLIMPORT helper
5269
5270 #define TX_DLLIMPORT( required, libName, retValType, funcName, funcParams, ... ) \
5271 retValType (__VA_ARGS__* funcName) funcParams = (retValType (__VA_ARGS__*) funcParams) \
5272 _txDllImport ((libName), #funcName, (required))
5273#endif

5764
5765const int _TX_TIMEOUT = 1000
5766
5767#if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
5768 * 2
5769#endif
5770
5771#if defined (TX_TRACE)
5772 * 3
5773#endif
5774
5775#if defined (_TX_USE_DEVPARTNER)
5776 * 10
5777#endif
5778 ;
5779

5826 HDC src, int xSrc, int ySrc, int wSrc, int hSrc, DWORD rOp) = NULL;
5827
5828#endif // TX_COMPILED
5829
5830extern bool (*_txSwapBuffers) (HDC dest, int xDest, int yDest, int wDest, int hDest,
5831 HDC src, int xSrc, int ySrc, int wSrc, int hSrc, DWORD rOp);

5841

5895#if !defined (_TX_WAITABLE_PARENTS)
5896 #define _TX_WAITABLE_PARENTS "Winpty-agent.exe:Clion.exe, " /* 0: CLion32 */ \
5897 "Winpty-agent.exe:Clion64.exe, " /* 1: CLion64 */ \
5898 "starter.exe:eclipse.exe, " /* 2: Eclipse 4 */ \
5899 "starter.exe:javaw.exe, " /* 3: Eclipse 3 */ \
5900 "cmd.exe:devenv.exe, " /* 4: MSVS 2003+ */ \
5901 "VSDebugConsole.exe:devenv.exe, " /* 5: MSVS 2019 */ \
5902 "consolepauser.exe:devcpp.exe, " /* 6: Dev-Cpp */ \
5903 "cb_console_runner.exe:codeblocks.exe" /* 7: CodeBlocks 8+ */
5904#endif

6034
6035//=================================================================================================================
6036//{ Internal diagnostics
6038//=================================================================================================================
6040//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6080//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6081
6082#ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
6083#define _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
6084#endif
6085
6086//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6116//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6117
6118#ifdef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
6119#define TX_TRACE
6120#endif
6121
6122#if !defined (TX_TRACE)
6123 #define TX_TRACE { if (_txLoc::Cur.trace) _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__); }
6124#endif
6125
6127void _txTrace (const char file[], int line, const char func[], const char msg[] = NULL, ...);
6129
6130//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6133
6134#ifndef FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
6135
6136struct _txLoc
6137 {
6138 const char* func;
6139 const char* file;
6140 int line;
6141
6142 int inTX; // We are inside one of TXLib functions
6143 int trace; // Internal TX trace level, when enabled by _TX_ALLOW_TRACE
6144
6145 const _txLoc* prev; // Caller's location
6146
6147 static _txLoc _tx_thread Cur;
6148 };
6149
6150struct _txFuncEntry
6151 {
6152 typedef _txFuncEntry this_t;
6153
6154 _txLoc loc;
6155
6156 _txFuncEntry() : loc (_txLoc::Cur) { _txLoc::Cur.inTX++; _txLoc::Cur.prev = &loc; }
6157 void restore() { _txLoc::Cur = loc; }
6158 ~_txFuncEntry() { restore(); }
6159
6160 private:
6161 _txFuncEntry (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6162 this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6163 };
6164
6165#if defined (_GCC_VER)
6166
6167 inline void __txLocCurSet (const char* _file, int _line, const char* _func)
6168 { _txLoc::Cur.file = _file; _txLoc::Cur.line = _line; _txLoc::Cur.func = _func; }
6169
6170#else
6171
6172 #define __txLocCurSet( _file, _line, _func ) \
6173 ( _txLoc::Cur.file = (_file), _txLoc::Cur.line = (_line), _txLoc::Cur.func = (_func) )
6174
6175#endif
6176
6177#define _txLocCurSet() __txLocCurSet (__FILE__, __LINE__, __TX_FUNCTION__)
6178
6179#define _txLocLvlSet(lvl) { _txLoc::Cur.trace = (lvl); }
6180
6181//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6182
6183#if defined ($0)
6184 #undef $0
6185 #endif
6186
6187#if defined ($1)
6188 #undef $1
6189 #endif
6190
6191#if defined ($2)
6192 #undef $2
6193 #endif
6194
6195#if defined ($3)
6196 #undef $3
6197 #endif
6198
6199#if defined ($4)
6200 #undef $4
6201 #endif
6202
6203#if defined ($5)
6204 #undef $5
6205 #endif
6206
6207#if defined ($6)
6208 #undef $6
6209 #endif
6210
6211#if defined ($7)
6212 #undef $7
6213 #endif
6214
6215#if defined ($8)
6216 #undef $8
6217 #endif
6218
6219#if defined ($9)
6220 #undef $9
6221 #endif
6222
6223#if defined ($)
6224 #undef $
6225 #endif
6226
6227#if defined ($$)
6228 #undef $$
6229 #endif
6230
6231//}
6232//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6233
6234#if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
6235
6236 #define _txEntry(lvl) _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; { if (lvl) _txLocLvlSet (lvl); $; }
6237
6238 #define $ { _txLocCurSet(); if (_txLoc::Cur.trace <= _TX_ALLOW_TRACE+0) { TX_TRACE; } }
6239
6240 #define $$ { __txFuncEntry.restore(); }
6241
6242#elif defined (_DEBUG)
6243
6244 #define _txEntry(lvl) _txFuncEntry __txFuncEntry; { $; }
6245
6246 #define $ { _txLocCurSet(); }
6247
6248 #define $$ { __txFuncEntry.restore(); }
6249
6250#else
6251
6252 #define _txEntry(lvl) ;
6253 #define $ ;
6254 #define $$ ;
6255
6256#endif
6257
6258//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6259
6260#define $0 _txEntry (0) // (Log level unchanged)
6261#define $1 _txEntry (1) // Regular functions
6262#define $2 _txEntry (2) // Resvd
6263#define $3 _txEntry (3) // Init/Cleanup
6264#define $4 _txEntry (4) // Init/Cleanup, misc functions
6265#define $5 _txEntry (5) // Error handling, entry points
6266#define $6 _txEntry (6) // Error handling, main part
6267#define $7 _txEntry (7) // Error handling, misc functions
6268#define $8 _txEntry (8) // Canvas worker thread
6269#define $9 _txEntry (9) // Resvd
6270
6271//}
6272//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6273
6274#endif // FOR_DOXYGEN_ONLY
6275
6278//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6279
6281//}
6282//=================================================================================================================
6283
6284//=================================================================================================================
6285//{ Sweet critical section blocking: txAutoLock class
6286//=================================================================================================================
6287
6288//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6304//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6305
6307extern CRITICAL_SECTION _txCanvas_LockBackBuf;
6309
6310class txAutoLock
6311 {
6312 typedef txAutoLock this_t;
6313
6314 public:
6315
6316//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6339//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6340
6341 explicit txAutoLock (CRITICAL_SECTION* cs, bool mandatory = true) :
6342 cs_ (cs)
6343 {
6344$1 if (!cs_) return;
6345
6346 if (mandatory) {$ EnterCriticalSection (cs_); }
6347 else {$ TryEnterCriticalSection (cs_)? 0 : (cs_ = NULL); }
6348 }
6349
6350//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6363//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6364
6365 explicit txAutoLock (bool mandatory = true) :
6366 cs_ (NULL)
6367 {
6368$1 new (this) txAutoLock (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf, mandatory);
6369 }
6370
6371//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6373//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6374
6375 ~txAutoLock()
6376 {
6377$1 if (!cs_) return;
6378$ LeaveCriticalSection (cs_); cs_ = NULL;
6379 }
6380
6381//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6384//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6385
6386 operator bool () const
6387 {
6388$1 return (cs_ != NULL);
6389 }
6390
6391//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6393//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6394
6395// private:
6396 CRITICAL_SECTION* cs_;
6397
6398//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6400//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6402
6403 private:
6404 txAutoLock (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6405 this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6406
6408
6409 };
6410
6411//}
6412//=================================================================================================================
6413
6414//=================================================================================================================
6415//{ Dialogs: txDialog class
6417//=================================================================================================================
6419//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6440//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6441
6442struct txDialog
6443 {
6444 typedef txDialog this_t;
6445
6446//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6459//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6460
6461 public:
6462 enum CONTROL
6463 {
6464 DIALOG = (int) 0x00000000,
6465 BUTTON = (int) 0xFFFF0080,
6466 EDIT = (int) 0xFFFF0081,
6467 STATIC = (int) 0xFFFF0082,
6468 LISTBOX = (int) 0xFFFF0083,
6469 SCROLLBAR = (int) 0xFFFF0084,
6470 COMBOBOX = (int) 0xFFFF0085,
6471 END = (int) 0x00000000
6472 };
6473
6474//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6491//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6492
6493 public:
6494 struct Layout
6495 { //-V802
6496 CONTROL wndclass;
6497 const char* caption;
6498 WORD id;
6499 short x;
6500 short y;
6501 short sx;
6502 short sy;
6503 DWORD style;
6504
6505 const char* font;
6506 WORD fontsize;
6507 };
6508
6509//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6517//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6518
6519 public:
6520 txDialog();
6521
6522//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6532//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6533
6534 explicit txDialog (const Layout* layout);
6535
6536//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6538//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6539
6540 virtual ~txDialog() {};
6541
6542//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6554//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6555
6556 const Layout* setLayout (const Layout *layout);
6557
6558//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6576//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6577
6578 virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam);
6579
6580//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6596//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6597
6598 intptr_t dialogBox (const Layout* layout = NULL, size_t bufsize = 0);
6599
6600//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6613//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6614
6615 intptr_t dialogBox (WORD resource);
6616
6617//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6619//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6620
6621 private:
6622 txDialog (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6623 this_t& operator = (const this_t&) _tx_delete;
6624
6625//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6627//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6628
6629 protected:
6630 static intptr_t CALLBACK DialogProc_ (HWND wnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wParam, LPARAM lParam);
6631
6632//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6634//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6635
6636 private:
6637 const Layout* layout_;
6638 };
6639
6641//}
6642//=================================================================================================================
6643
6644//=================================================================================================================
6645//{ Dialogs: Message Map macros
6647//=================================================================================================================
6649//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6670//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6671
6672#define TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP() \
6673 virtual int dialogProc (HWND _wnd, UINT _msg, WPARAM _wParam, LPARAM _lParam) _tx_override \
6674 { \
6675 int _result = txDialog::dialogProc (_wnd, _msg, _wParam, _lParam); (void) _result; \
6676 \
6677 switch (_msg) \
6678 { \
6679 case WM_NULL:
6680
6681//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6700//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6701
6702#define TX_HANDLE( id ) \
6703 break; \
6704 case (id):
6705
6706//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6726//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6727
6728#define TX_COMMAND_MAP \
6729 default: break; \
6730 } \
6731 \
6732 if (_msg == WM_COMMAND) switch (LOWORD (_wParam)) \
6733 { \
6734 case 0:
6735
6736//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6755//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6756
6757#define TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP \
6758 default: break; \
6759 } \
6760 \
6761 return FALSE; \
6762 }
6763
6765//}
6766//=================================================================================================================
6767
6768//=================================================================================================================
6769//{ Dialogs: txDialog example: txInputBox()
6771//=================================================================================================================
6773//{----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6793//}----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6794
6795const char* txInputBox (const char* text = NULL, const char* caption = NULL, const char* input = NULL) tx_nodiscard;
6796
6797#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
6798
6799const char* txInputBox (const char* text, const char* caption, const char* input)
6800 {
6801 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6802 // Если не указаны параметры, приходится использовать хоть какие-то надписи.
6803 // txGetModuleFileName() -- имя EXE-файла, на случай, если кое-кто поленился задать название.
6804 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6805
6806 if (!text) text = "Введите строку:";
6807 if (!caption) caption = txGetModuleFileName (false);
6808 if (!input) input = "";
6809
6810 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6811 // Идентификаторы элементов диалога. Они требуются в GetDlgItemText().
6812 // Если диалог строится не вручную, а редактором ресурсов, то они задаются в нем автоматически.
6813 // У нас же тут -- хардкор стайл, к сожалению. Причина в том, что у разных сред программирования разные редакторы
6814 // ресурсов и системы сборки. Поэтому для независимости от них все будет строиться на этапе выполнения,
6815 // динамически. Вы еще гляньте, как это реализовано в txDialog::dialogBox() и функциях _tx_DLGTEMPLATE_()... О_о
6816 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6817
6818 #define ID_TEXT_ 101
6819 #define ID_INPUT_ 102
6820
6821 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6822 // Задание макета (вида) диалога в виде массива структур.
6823 // С помощью особого порядка полей в структуре txDialog::Layout и констант из класса txDialog этот массив
6824 // становится похож на описание ресурса диалога в .rc-файле.
6825 // См. описание синтаксиса rc-файла в документации по Win32 (MSDN, http://msdn.com).
6826 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6827
6828 txDialog::Layout layout[] =
6829
6830 //----------------------+----------+-----------+-----------------+---------------------------------------------
6831 // Тип элемента | Имя | Иденти- | Координаты | Флаги элементов
6832 // диалога | элемента | фикатор |-----------------| (см. описание элементов
6833 // | | элемента | X | Y |Шир.|Выс.| окон диалога в MSDN)
6834 //----------------------+----------+-----------+---+---+----+----+---------------------------------------------
6835 // | | | | | | |
6836 {{ txDialog::DIALOG, caption, 0, 0, 0, 240, 85 },
6837 { txDialog::STATIC, text, ID_TEXT_, 10, 10, 150, 40, SS_LEFT },
6838 { txDialog::EDIT, input, ID_INPUT_, 10, 60, 220, 15, ES_LEFT | WS_BORDER | ES_AUTOHSCROLL | WS_TABSTOP },
6839 { txDialog::BUTTON, "&OK", IDOK, 180, 10, 50, 15, BS_DEFPUSHBUTTON | WS_TABSTOP },
6840 { txDialog::BUTTON, "&Cancel", IDCANCEL, 180, 30, 50, 15, BS_PUSHBUTTON | WS_TABSTOP },
6841 { txDialog::END }};
6842
6843 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6844 // Класс диалога для InputBox. Внутренний, т.к. зачем ему быть внешним.
6845 // Нужен в основном для задания строки ввода (str) и оконной функции диалогового окна, требуемой Win32 (она
6846 // построена макросами TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP и другими). Можно не делать внутреннего класса, но тогда оконную
6847 // функцию придется писать в глобальной области видимости, и str объявлять глобально тоже (или передавать ее
6848 // адрес через DialogBoxParam и записывать его в класс во время обработки WM_INITDIALOG).
6849 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6850 struct inputDlg : txDialog
6851 {
6852 char str [1024];
6853
6854 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6855
6856 inputDlg() :
6857 str()
6858 {}
6859
6860 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6861
6862 TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP() // Карта сообщений (на самом деле это начало оконной функции). //-V2525
6863
6864 TX_COMMAND_MAP // Здесь обрабатываются WM_COMMAND (на самом деле это оператор switch).
6865
6866 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6867 // При нажатии кнопки OK копируем строку из поля ввода в нашу переменную str, т.к. после закрытия
6868 // диалога строка ввода умрет и текст уже из нее получить.
6869 // Этот макрос на самом деле превращается в case из оператора switch.
6870 // _wnd -- это параметр оконной функции, см. определение макроса TX_BEGIN_MESSAGE_MAP().
6871 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6872
6873 TX_HANDLE (IDOK) GetDlgItemText (_wnd, ID_INPUT_, str, sizeof (str) - 1);
6874
6875 TX_END_MESSAGE_MAP //-V2522
6876
6877 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6878 // Конец внутреннего класса диалога
6879 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6880 };
6881
6882 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6883 // Убираем дефайны, чтобы потом не мешали.
6884 // От этого они получаются "локального действия", как будто у них была бы область видимости -- функция. На самом
6885 // деле это сделано вручную через #undef. Чтобы подчеркнуть их локальную природу, у них имена заканчиваются на _.
6886 // Такие дефайны потом не перекосячат весь код после того как, фактически, стали уже не нужны.
6887 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6888
6889 #undef ID_TEXT_
6890 #undef ID_INPUT_
6891
6892 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6893 // Это статический объект, потому что строка в нем должна жить после завершения функции.
6894 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6895
6896 static inputDlg dlg;
6897
6898 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6899 // Передаем layout и запускаем окно диалога
6900 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6901
6902 dlg.dialogBox (layout);
6903
6904 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6905 // Возвращаем адрес строки из статического объекта. Так можно делать, потому что статический объект не умрет
6906 // при выходе из функции и строка в нем, соответственно, тоже. Адрес нестатических переменных передавать
6907 // синтаксически можно, но ведет к серьезным ошибкам.
6908 //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6909
6910 return dlg.str;
6911 }
6912
6913#endif // TX_COMPILED
6914
6916//}
6917//=================================================================================================================
6918
6919//}
6920//=================================================================================================================
6921
6922//=================================================================================================================
6923//{ TXLIB IMPLEMENTATION
6924// Реализация функций библиотеки
6925//=================================================================================================================
6927
6928//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6929//{ The Includes
6930//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6931
6932#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
6933
6934_TX_END_NAMESPACE
6935
6936//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
6937
6938#if defined (_MSC_VER)
6939 #pragma warning (push, 3) // MSVC: At level /Wall, some std headers emit warnings... O_o
6940
6941 #pragma warning (disable: 4365) // 'argument': conversion from 'long' to 'unsigned int', signed/unsigned mismatch
6942 #pragma warning (disable: 4005) // 'name': macro redefinition
6943#endif
6944
6945#if defined (__STRICT_ANSI__) && defined (__STRICT_ANSI__UNDEFINED)
6946 #undef __STRICT_ANSI__
6947#endif
6948

6951#include <stdarg.h>
6952#include <io.h>
6953#include <fcntl.h>
6954#include <process.h>
6955#include <signal.h>
6956#include <setjmp.h>
6957#include <locale.h>
6958#include <limits.h>
6959#include <stdint.h>
6960
6961#include <map>
6962#include <numeric>
6963#include <exception>
6964#include <stdexcept>
6965
6966#include <tlhelp32.h>
6967#include <shellapi.h>
6968
6969#if defined (_GCC_VER)
6970
6971#include <shlobj.h>
6972
6973#include <cxxabi.h>
6974#include <unwind.h>
6975
6976#endif
6977
6978#if defined (__CYGWIN__)
6979
6980#include <stdarg.h>
6981#include <unistd.h>
6982#include <termios.h>
6983
6984#endif
6985
6986#if defined (_MSC_VER)
6987
6988#include <new.h>
6989
6990#include <shlobj.h>

7069#ifndef SYMOPT_CASE_INSENSITIVE
7070#define SYMOPT_CASE_INSENSITIVE 0x00000001
7071#define SYMOPT_UNDNAME 0x00000002
7072#define SYMOPT_DEFERRED_LOADS 0x00000004
7073#define SYMOPT_NO_CPP 0x00000008
7074#define SYMOPT_LOAD_LINES 0x00000010
7075#define SYMOPT_OMAP_FIND_NEAREST 0x00000020
7076#define SYMOPT_LOAD_ANYTHING 0x00000040
7077#define SYMOPT_IGNORE_CVREC 0x00000080
7078#define SYMOPT_NO_UNQUALIFIED_LOADS 0x00000100
7079#define SYMOPT_FAIL_CRITICAL_ERRORS 0x00000200
7080#define SYMOPT_EXACT_SYMBOLS 0x00000400
7081#define SYMOPT_ALLOW_ABSOLUTE_SYMBOLS 0x00000800
7082#define SYMOPT_IGNORE_NT_SYMPATH 0x00001000
7083#define SYMOPT_INCLUDE_32BIT_MODULES 0x00002000
7084#define SYMOPT_PUBLICS_ONLY 0x00004000
7085#define SYMOPT_NO_PUBLICS 0x00008000
7086#define SYMOPT_AUTO_PUBLICS 0x00010000
7087#define SYMOPT_NO_IMAGE_SEARCH 0x00020000
7088#define SYMOPT_SECURE 0x00040000
7089#define SYMOPT_NO_PROMPTS 0x00080000
7090#define SYMOPT_ALLOW_ZERO_ADDRESS 0x01000000
7091#define SYMOPT_DISABLE_SYMSRV_AUTODETECT 0x02000000
7092#define SYMOPT_FAVOR_COMPRESSED 0x00800000
7093#define SYMOPT_FLAT_DIRECTORY 0x00400000
7094#define SYMOPT_IGNORE_IMAGEDIR 0x00200000
7095#define SYMOPT_OVERWRITE 0x00100000
7096#define SYMOPT_DEBUG 0x80000000
7097#endif

7099// SEH exception codes. For GCC, see http://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/blob/master/libgcc/unwind-seh.c, lines 64-66.
7100
7101#ifndef STATUS_POSSIBLE_DEADLOCK
7102#define STATUS_POSSIBLE_DEADLOCK 0xC0000194
7103#endif
7104
7105#ifndef STATUS_FLOAT_MULTIPLE_FAULTS
7106#define STATUS_FLOAT_MULTIPLE_FAULTS 0xC00002B4
7107#endif

7110#define STATUS_STACK_BUFFER_OVERRUN 0xC0000409
7111#endif

7114#define STATUS_ASSERTION_FAILURE 0xC0000420
7115#endif

7122#define DBG_PRINTEXCEPTION_C 0x40010006 // OutputDebugStringA() call
7123#endif
7124

7133#define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC 0xE06D7363 // '?msc'
7134#define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1 0x19930520 // '?msc' version magic, see ehdata.h
7135#define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2 0x19930521 // '?msc' version magic
7136#define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3 0x19930522 // '?msc' version magic
7137#define EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_PURE_MAGIC_NUMBER1 0x01994000 // '?msc' version magic
7138
7139#define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC 0x20474343 // ' GCC'
7140#define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_UNWIND 0x21474343 // '!GCC'
7141#define EXCEPTION_CPP_GCC_FORCED 0x22474343 // '"GCC'
7142
7143#define EXCEPTION_CLR_FAILURE 0xE0434f4D // 'аCOM'
7144
7145#define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_BUILDER 0x0EEDFAE6 // Should never occur here
7146#define EXCEPTION_CPP_BORLAND_DELPHI 0x0EEDFADE // Should never occur here

7224
7225#undef INTERFACE
7226#define INTERFACE IShellLinkDataList
7227
7228DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (IShellLinkDataList, IUnknown)
7229 {
7230 STDMETHOD (AddDataBlock) (THIS_ void* dataBlock) PURE;
7231 STDMETHOD (CopyDataBlock) (THIS_ DWORD sig, void** dataBlock) PURE;
7232 STDMETHOD (RemoveDataBlock) (THIS_ DWORD sig) PURE;
7233 STDMETHOD (GetFlags) (THIS_ DWORD* flags) PURE;
7234 STDMETHOD (SetFlags) (THIS_ DWORD flags) PURE;
7235 };
7236
7237#undef INTERFACE
7238#define INTERFACE ITaskbarList
7239
7240DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (ITaskbarList, IUnknown)
7241 {
7242 STDMETHOD (HrInit) (THIS) PURE;
7243 STDMETHOD (AddTab) (THIS_ HWND wnd) PURE;
7244 STDMETHOD (DeleteTab) (THIS_ HWND wnd) PURE;
7245 STDMETHOD (ActivateTab) (THIS_ HWND wnd) PURE;
7246 STDMETHOD (SetActiveAlt) (THIS_ HWND wnd) PURE;
7247 };
7248
7249#undef INTERFACE
7250#define INTERFACE ITaskbarList2
7251
7252DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (ITaskbarList2, ITaskbarList)
7253 {
7254 STDMETHOD (MarkFullscreenWindow) (THIS_ HWND wnd, BOOL fullscreen) PURE;
7255 };
7256
7257#undef INTERFACE
7258#define INTERFACE ITaskbarList3
7259
7260DECLARE_INTERFACE_ (ITaskbarList3, ITaskbarList2)
7261 {
7262 STDMETHOD (SetProgressValue) (THIS_ HWND wnd, ULONGLONG completed, ULONGLONG total) PURE;
7263 STDMETHOD (SetProgressState) (THIS_ HWND wnd, unsigned flags) PURE;
7264 STDMETHOD (RegisterTab) (THIS_ HWND wndTab, HWND wndMDI) PURE;
7265 STDMETHOD (UnregisterTab) (THIS_ HWND wndTab) PURE;
7266 STDMETHOD (SetTabOrder) (THIS_ HWND wndTab, HWND wndInsertBefore) PURE;
7267 STDMETHOD (SetTabActive) (THIS_ HWND wndTab, HWND wndMDI, DWORD reserved) PURE;
7268 STDMETHOD (ThumbBarAddButtons) (THIS_ HWND wnd, UINT buttons, const void* button) PURE;
7269 STDMETHOD (ThumbBarUpdateButtons) (THIS_ HWND wnd, UINT buttons, const void* button) PURE;
7270 STDMETHOD (ThumbBarSetImageList) (THIS_ HWND wnd, HIMAGELIST himl) PURE;
7271 STDMETHOD (SetOverlayIcon) (THIS_ HWND wnd, HICON icon, const wchar_t* description) PURE;
7272 STDMETHOD (SetThumbnailTooltip) (THIS_ THIS_ HWND wnd, const wchar_t* tip) PURE;
7273 STDMETHOD (SetThumbnailClip) (THIS_ HWND wnd, RECT* clip) PURE;
7274 };

7276#undef INTERFACE

7366 };

7527struct MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK
7528 {
7529 ULONG ThreadId;
7530 HANDLE ThreadHandle;
7531 CONTEXT Context;
7532 ULONG SizeOfContext;
7533 ULONG64 StackBase;
7534 ULONG64 StackEnd;
7535 };

7538 {

7540 HANDLE ThreadHandle;
7541 CONTEXT Context;
7542 ULONG SizeOfContext;
7543 ULONG64 StackBase;
7544 ULONG64 StackEnd;
7545 ULONG64 BackingStoreBase;
7546 ULONG64 BackingStoreEnd;
7547 };
7548

7556 VS_FIXEDFILEINFO VersionInfo;

7561 };

7584 };

7594 {

7598
7599struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT
7600 {
7601 ULONG ProcessId;
7602 HANDLE ProcessHandle;
7603 ULONG CallbackType;
7604
7605 union //-V2514
7606 {
7607 MINIDUMP_THREAD_CALLBACK Thread;
7608 MINIDUMP_THREAD_EX_CALLBACK ThreadEx;
7609 MINIDUMP_MODULE_CALLBACK Module;
7610 MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_THREAD_CALLBACK IncludeThread;
7611 MINIDUMP_INCLUDE_MODULE_CALLBACK IncludeModule;
7612 };
7613 };
7614
7615struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT
7616 {
7617 union //-V2514
7618 {
7619 ULONG ModuleWriteFlags;
7620 ULONG ThreadWriteFlags;
7621 ULONG SecondaryFlags;
7622
7623 struct
7624 {
7625 ULONG64 MemoryBase;
7626 ULONG MemorySize;
7627 };
7628
7629 struct
7630 {
7631 unsigned CheckCancel;
7632 unsigned Cancel;
7633 };
7634
7635 HANDLE Handle; //-V117
7636 };
7637
7638 struct
7639 {
7640 MINIDUMP_MEMORY_INFO VmRegion;
7641 unsigned Continue;
7642 };
7643
7644 HRESULT Status;
7645 };
7646
7647struct MINIDUMP_EXCEPTION_INFORMATION
7648 {
7649 DWORD ThreadId;
7650 EXCEPTION_POINTERS* ExceptionPointers;
7651 unsigned ClientPointers;
7652 };
7653
7654typedef int (WINAPI* MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE) (void* param, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INPUT* input, MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_OUTPUT* output);
7655
7656struct MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_INFORMATION
7657 {
7658 MINIDUMP_CALLBACK_ROUTINE CallbackRoutine;
7659 void* CallbackParam;
7660 };
7661
7662enum MINIDUMP_TYPE
7663 {
7664 MiniDumpNormal = 0x00000000,
7665 MiniDumpWithDataSegs = 0x00000001,
7666 MiniDumpWithFullMemory = 0x00000002,
7667 MiniDumpWithHandleData = 0x00000004,
7668 MiniDumpFilterMemory = 0x00000008,
7669 MiniDumpScanMemory = 0x00000010,
7670 MiniDumpWithUnloadedModules = 0x00000020,
7671 MiniDumpWithIndirectlyReferencedMemory = 0x00000040,
7672 MiniDumpFilterModulePaths = 0x00000080,
7673 MiniDumpWithProcessThreadData = 0x00000100,
7674 MiniDumpWithPrivateReadWriteMemory = 0x00000200,
7675 MiniDumpWithoutOptionalData = 0x00000400,
7676 MiniDumpWithFullMemoryInfo = 0x00000800,
7677 MiniDumpWithThreadInfo = 0x00001000,
7678 MiniDumpWithCodeSegs = 0x00002000,
7679 MiniDumpWithoutAuxiliaryState = 0x00004000,
7680 MiniDumpWithFullAuxiliaryState = 0x00008000,
7681 MiniDumpWithPrivateWriteCopyMemory = 0x00010000,
7682 MiniDumpIgnoreInaccessibleMemory = 0x00020000,
7683 MiniDumpWithTokenInformation = 0x00040000
7684 };
7685
7686#ifndef CONTEXT_ALL
7687#define CONTEXT_ALL ( CONTEXT_CONTROL | CONTEXT_INTEGER | CONTEXT_SEGMENTS | CONTEXT_FLOATING_POINT | CONTEXT_DEBUG_REGISTERS )
7688#endif

7695
7696#define FOREGROUND_BLACK ( 0 )
7697#define FOREGROUND_CYAN ( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN )
7698#define FOREGROUND_MAGENTA ( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_RED )
7699#define FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW ( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED )
7700#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY ( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_RED )
7701#define FOREGROUND_DARKGRAY ( FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7702#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTBLUE ( FOREGROUND_BLUE | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7703#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTGREEN ( FOREGROUND_GREEN | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7704#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTCYAN ( FOREGROUND_CYAN | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7705#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTRED ( FOREGROUND_RED | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7706#define FOREGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA ( FOREGROUND_MAGENTA | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7707#define FOREGROUND_YELLOW ( FOREGROUND_DARKYELLOW | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7708#define FOREGROUND_WHITE ( FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY | FOREGROUND_INTENSITY )
7709
7710#define BACKGROUND_BLACK ( 0 )
7711#define BACKGROUND_CYAN ( BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_GREEN )
7712#define BACKGROUND_MAGENTA ( BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_RED )
7713#define BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW ( BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED )
7714#define BACKGROUND_GRAY ( BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_RED )
7715#define BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY ( BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7716#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTBLUE ( BACKGROUND_BLUE | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7717#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTGREEN ( BACKGROUND_GREEN | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7718#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTCYAN ( BACKGROUND_CYAN | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7719#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTRED ( BACKGROUND_RED | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7720#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTMAGENTA ( BACKGROUND_MAGENTA | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7721#define BACKGROUND_LIGHTYELLOW ( BACKGROUND_DARKYELLOW | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7722#define BACKGROUND_WHITE ( BACKGROUND_DARKGRAY | BACKGROUND_INTENSITY )
7723
7724//}
7725//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7726
7727//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7728//{ There are copies of MSVC compiler built-in predefined definitions, which are wrong in 64-bit mode.
7729// So we have to override them. See: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/39113168
7730//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7731
7732#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
7733
7734#if defined (_MSC_VER)
7735 // MS ABI C++ Exception Layout
7736namespace Win32 { // ---------------------------
7737 //
7738#pragma pack (push, 4) // EXCEPTION_RECORD:
7739 // +==================================================+
7740struct ThrowInfo // |... |
7741 { // |NumberParameters: 3, 4 or more |
7742 __int32 attributes; // |ExceptionInformation[0]: MS signature 0x19930520 |
7743 __int32 pmfnUnwind; // |ExceptionInformation[1]: object* thrown |
7744 __int32 pForwardCompat; // |ExceptionInformation[2]: ThrowInfo* --------------+---+
7745 __int32 pCatchableTypeArray; // |ExceptionInformation[3]: ImageBase (if params > 3)| |
7746 }; // +==================================================+ |
7747 // |
7748struct CatchableTypeArray // ThrowInfo: |
7749 { // +======================================+ <-------+
7750 __int32 nCatchableTypes; // | ... |
7751 __int32 arrayOfCatchableTypes[]; // +-----+-- pCatchableTypeArray (ptr/RVA) |
7752 }; // | +======================================+
7753 // |
7754struct CatchableType // | CatchableTypeArray:
7755 { // +---> +======================================+
7756 __int32 properties; // | ... |
7757 __int32 pType; // +-----+-- arrayOfCatchableTypes[0] (ptr/RVA) |
7758 __int32 thisDisplacement[3]; // struct _PMD // | +======================================+
7759 __int32 sizeOrOffset; // |
7760 __int32 copyFunction; // | CatchableType:
7761 }; // +---> +====================+
7762 // | ... | std::type_info:
7763#pragma pack (pop) // | pType (ptr/RVA) ---+------> +==================+
7764 // | ... | |type_info data |
7765} // namespace Win32 // +====================+ |... |
7766 // +==================+
7767#endif
7768
7769// Similar to __CxxDetectRethrow(), see C:\Bin\Microsoft Visual Studio 14.0\VC\crt\src\crtsrc\vcruntime\frame.cpp:
7770
7771#define _TX_MSC__CXX_DETECT_RETHROW( exc ) \
7772 ( \
7773 (exc) && \
7774 (exc) -> ExceptionCode == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC && \
7775 (exc) -> NumberParameters >= 3 && \
7776 \
7777 ((exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER1 || \
7778 (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER2 || \
7779 (exc)-> ExceptionInformation[0] == EXCEPTION_CPP_MSC_EH_MAGIC_NUMBER3) && \
7780 \
7781 (exc) -> ExceptionInformation[2] == 0 \
7782 )
7783
7784#endif // TX_COMPILED
7785
7786//}
7787//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7788
7789//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7790//{ The corresponding structures for GCC
7791//
7792// From: http://github.com/gcc-mirror/gcc/blob/master/libstdc%2B%2B-v3/libsupc%2B%2B/unwind-cxx.h
7793// See: http://mentorembedded.github.io/cxx-abi/abi-eh.html#cxx-abi
7794//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7795
7796#if defined (_GCC_VER)
7797
7798#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
7799
7800 // GCC ABI C++ Exception layout. A/B are ExceptionInformation[0].
7801namespace ABI { // --------------------------------------------------------------
7802 //
7803struct __cxa_exception // Case A: "_Unwind_Exception* A" is undependent exception:
7804 { // --------------------------------------------------------
7805 union { //
7806 struct // __cxa_exception: std::type_info:
7807 { // -*--+====================+ +==================+
7808 ::std::type_info* exceptionType; // ^ |exceptionType* -----+---->|type_info data |
7809 void (*exceptionDestructor)(void*); // | |... | |... |
7810 }; // -1 | | +==================+
7811 struct // | | |
7812 { // A >----|--+--------------------+
7813 __cxa_exception* primaryException; // | | |unwindHeader |
7814 void (*padding)(); // +1 | | |
7815 }; // | | | |
7816 }; // V | | |
7817 // -*--- +====================+
7818 std::unexpected_handler unexpectedHandler; // |object |
7819 std::terminate_handler terminateHandler; // +--------------------+
7820 //
7821 __cxa_exception* nextException; // Case B: "_Unwind_Exception* B" is dependent exception
7822 int handlerCount; // (unwindHeader.exception_class & 1 != 0):
7823 int handlerSwitchValue; // -----------------------------------------------------
7824 const unsigned char* actionRecord; //
7825 const unsigned char* languageSpecificData; // __cxa_exception: __cxa_exception:
7826 void* catchTemp; // -*--+====================+ -*--+=================+
7827 void* adjustedPtr; // ^ |primaryException* --+-- ^ |exceptionType* |
7828 // | |... | \ | |... |
7829 _Unwind_Exception unwindHeader; // -1 | | | | | |
7830 }; // | | | | | | |
7831 // B >----|--+--------------------+ | -1 +-----------------+
7832struct __cxa_eh_globals // | | |unwindHeader | | | |unwindHeader |
7833 { // +1 | | | | | | |
7834 __cxa_exception* caughtExceptions; // | | | | | | | |
7835 unsigned int uncaughtExceptions; // V | | | \ | | |
7836 }; // -*--- +====================+ -->*--+=================+
7837 // |... | |object |
7838} // namespace ABI // . . | |
7839 // +-----------------+
7840
7841extern "C" ABI::__cxa_eh_globals* __cxa_get_globals();
7842
7843#endif // TX_COMPILED
7844
7845#endif
7846
7847//}
7848//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7849
7850//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7851//{ Hand-made IAT.
7852// Some IDEs don't link with these libs by default in console projects, so do sunrise by hand. :(
7853//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7854
7855// Hand-made DLLIMPORT helpers
7856
7857#define _TX_DLLIMPORT( lib, retval, name, params ) TX_DLLIMPORT (true, lib ".dll", retval, name, params, WINAPI)
7858#define _TX_DLLIMPORT_OPT( lib, retval, name, params ) TX_DLLIMPORT (false, lib ".dll", retval, name, params, WINAPI)
7859#define _TX_DLLIMPORT_CRT( lib, retval, name, params ) TX_DLLIMPORT (false, lib ".dll", retval, name, params)
7860
7861void (*_txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required = true)) ();
7862
7863//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
7864
7865#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
7866
7867namespace Win32 {

8086int _txGetInput();
8087
8088LRESULT CALLBACK _txPlayVideo_WndProc (HWND wnd, UINT msg, WPARAM wpar, LPARAM lpar);
8089const char* _txPlayVideo_FindVLC() tx_nodiscard;
8090
8091bool _txCreateShortcut (const char shortcutName[],
8092 const char fileToLink[], const char args[] = NULL, const char workDir[] = NULL,
8093 const char description[] = NULL, int cmdShow = SW_SHOWNORMAL,
8094 const char iconFile[] = NULL, int iconIndex = 0, int fontSize = 0,
8095 COORD bufSize = ZERO (COORD), COORD wndSize = ZERO (COORD), COORD wndOrg = ZERO (COORD));

8098 WORD controls, short x, short y, short cx, short cy,
8099 const char caption[], const char font[], WORD fontsize,
8100 const char menu[]) tx_nodiscard;

8104 WORD id, const char wclass[], const char caption[]);

8106const char* _txProcessError (const char file[], int line, const char func[], unsigned color,
8107 const char msg[], va_list args);
8108void _txOnTerminate();

8110void _txOnPureCall();
8111void _txOnNewHandlerAnsi();
8112int _txOnNewHandler (size_t size);
8113void _txOnSignal (int signal = 0, int fpe = 0);
8114BOOL WINAPI _txOnConsoleCtrlEvent (DWORD type);
8115void _txOnSecurityError (int code, void*);
8116void _txOnSecurityErrorAnsi (const char* msg, void* ptr, int code);
8117int _txOnMatherr (_exception* except);
8118void _txOnInvalidParam (const wchar_t* expr, const wchar_t* func, const wchar_t* file,
8119 unsigned line, uintptr_t);
8120int _txOnAllocHook (int type, void* data, size_t size, int use, long request,
8121 const unsigned char* file, int line);
8122int _txOnRTCFailure (int type, const char* file, int line, const char* module, const char* format, ...) tx_printfy (5);
8123int _txOnErrorReport (int type, const char* text, int* ret);
8124int tx_glGetError (int setError = INT_MIN);
8125
8126void _txOnCExit();
8127void _txOnExit (int retcode);
8128void _txOnFatalExit (int retcode);
8129void _txOnExitProcess (unsigned retcode);
8130void _txOnFatalAppExitA (unsigned action, const char message[]);
8131bool _txOnTerminateProcess (HANDLE process, unsigned retcode);
8132LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER WINAPI
8133 _txOnSetUnhandledExceptionFilter (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER filter);
8134void _txWatchdogTerminator (void* timeout); // Only Arnold-type series are supported, not T1000
8135
8136long WINAPI _txVectoredExceptionHandler (EXCEPTION_POINTERS* exc);
8137long WINAPI _txUnhandledExceptionFilter (EXCEPTION_POINTERS* exc);
8138long _txOnExceptionSEH (EXCEPTION_POINTERS* exc, const char func[]);
8139intptr_t _txDumpExceptionSEH (char what[], intptr_t size, const EXCEPTION_RECORD* exc, const char func[]);
8140intptr_t _txDumpExceptionObj (char what[], intptr_t size, void* object, size_t sizeObj, const std::type_info* type);
8141intptr_t _txDumpExceptionCPP (char what[], intptr_t size, unsigned code = 0,
8142 unsigned params = 0, const ULONG_PTR info[] = NULL);
8143

8145 bool readSource = true);
8146const char* _txCaptureStackBackTrace (int framesToSkip = 0, bool readSource = true,
8147 CONTEXT* context = NULL, EXCEPTION_POINTERS* exc = NULL, HANDLE thread = GetCurrentThread());
8148int _txStackWalk (int framesToSkip, size_t szCapture, void* capture[], CONTEXT* context = NULL,
8149 HANDLE thread = GetCurrentThread());
8150const char* _txCaptureStackBackTraceTX (int framesToSkip = 0, bool readSource = false);
8151

8153bool _txSymGetFromAddr (void* addr, Win32::SYMBOL_INFO** symbol = NULL,
8154 Win32::IMAGEHLP_LINE64** line = NULL, const char** module = NULL,
8155 const char** source = NULL, int context = 2);

8157 int linStart = 0, int linEnd = INT_MIN, int linMark = INT_MIN);

8161 int useHotPatching = false, HMODULE module = NULL, bool debug = false);
8162bool _txInDll() tx_nodiscard;

8164bool _txKillProcess (DWORD pid);
8165int _txTaskKill (const char name[] /*= NULL*/, const char cmdLineSubstr[] /*= NULL*/, unsigned pid /*= 0*/);
8166bool _txCheckSourceCP (int needCP = _TX_CODEPAGE, bool verbose = true);
