8197
8198//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8199// There are macros for __FILE__ and __LINE__ to work properly.
8200
8201#if !defined (NDEBUG)
8202
8203 #define _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond ) ( !(cond) && \
8204 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) && \
8205 (assert (cond), true) )
8206
8207 #define _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED() ( !txOK() && \
8208 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0), 1) && \
8209 (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования не создано или не в порядке."), 1) )
8210
8211 #define _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc ) ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) && \
8212 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0), 1) && \
8213 (TX_ERROR ("Параметр \"%s\" неверен. Возможно, этот холст не создан, " \
8214 "или уже уничтожен, или не загрузилась картинка.", #dc), 1) )
8215 #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc) ( (!(dc) && \
8216 _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) || _TX_HDC_FAILED (dc) )
8217
8218#else
8219 #define _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED( cond ) ( !(cond) && \
8220 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_BAD_ARGUMENTS, 0), 1) )
8221
8222 #define _TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED() ( !txOK() && \
8223 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0), 1) )
8224
8225 #define _TX_HDC_FAILED( dc ) ( !Win32::GetObjectType (dc) && \
8226 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0), 1) )
8227
8228 #define _TX_DEFAULT_HDC_FAILED(dc) ( !(dc) && \
8229 (SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0), 1) )
8230#endif
8231
8232//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8233// Take action in debug configuration only.
8234// Definition ({ expr; }) would be better, but MSVC rejects it. So sad. :'(
8235
8236#if !defined (NDEBUG)
8237 #define _TX_ON_DEBUG( code ) { code; }
8238#else
8239 #define _TX_ON_DEBUG( code ) ;
8240#endif
8241
8242//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8243// Invokes an error without location information. "$$" restores TX-related call location context
8244
8245#define _TX_UNEXPECTED( ... ) $$ _txError (NULL, 0, NULL, 0, ##__VA_ARGS__)
8246
8247//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8248// Safe call of a function via its pointer
8249
8250#define _TX_CALL( func, param ) ( (func)? ((func) param) : 0 )
8251#define _TX_CALLv( func, param ) ( (func)? ((func) param) : (void)0 )
8252
8253//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8254// This is a macro because cond is an expression and is not always a function. Lack of lambdas in pre-C++0x.
8255
8256#define _txWaitFor( cond, time ) { for (DWORD _t = GetTickCount() + (time); \
8257 !(cond) && GetTickCount() < _t; \
8258 Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval)) ; \
8259 if (!(cond)) \
8260 _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Timeout: " #cond "."); }
8261//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8262// Detouring in case of SEH mechanism
8263
8264#define _txSetJmp() ( setjmp (_txDumpExceptionObjJmp) == 0 )
8265
8266#define _txClearJmp() { *(unsigned long long*) _txDumpExceptionObjJmp = 0; }
8267
8268//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8269// IN and OUT are defined in WinDef.h to support Microsoft SAL. Remove them because they are often confused with user's code.
8270
8271#if defined (IN)
8272 #undef IN
8273#endif
8274
8275#if defined (IN)
8276 #undef OUT
8277#endif
8278
8280//}
8281//=================================================================================================================
8282
8283//=================================================================================================================
8284//{ Internal global data
8286//
8287// Данные не упакованы в структуру или класс, для того, чтобы это сделали Вы сами :)
8288//
8289// Если вы пишете свою библиотеку и используете TXLib.h как пример, не следуйте ему и не делайте так же.
8290// Здесь это сделано только в образовательных целях.
8291//
8292// Будьте практичнее, сделайте структуру и глобальную функцию для доступа к ней, или класс.
8293//=================================================================================================================
8295
8296#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<<<<<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
8297
8298const int _TX_IDM_ABOUT = 40000, // Идентификаторы системного меню окна
8299 _TX_IDM_CONSOLE = 40001,
8300 _TX_WM_CREATEWND = 0x7FF0, // Сообщения для создания/уничтожения
8301 _TX_WM_DESTROYWND = 0x7FF1; // окон в потоке Canvas
8302
8303//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8304
8305volatile unsigned _txCanaryFirst = 0x776F656D; // A very system value
8306
8307int _txInitialized = (_TX_NOINIT +0)? 0 : _txInitialize();
8308
8309volatile unsigned _txMainThreadId = 0; // ID потока, где выполняется main()
8310volatile HANDLE _txMainThread = NULL; // Дексриптор этого потока
8311
8312volatile unsigned _txCanvas_ThreadId = 0; // ID потока, владеющего окном холста TXLib
8313volatile HANDLE _txCanvas_Thread = NULL; // Дексриптор этого потока
8314volatile HWND _txCanvas_Window = NULL; // Дескриптор окна холста TXLib
8315
8316HDC _txCanvas_BackBuf[2] = {NULL, // [0] Main TXLib in-memory DC, where user's pictures lies
8317 NULL}; // [1] Image ready for auto-refresh, see txCanvas_OnPAINT()
8318
8319RGBQUAD* _txCanvas_Pixels = NULL; // Memory buffer of _txCanvas_BackBuf[0]
8320
8321HBITMAP _txStockBitmap = NULL; // Equivalent of GetStockObject (BITMAP),
8322 // see https://devblogs.microsoft.com/oldnewthing/20100416-00/?p=14313
8323
8324CRITICAL_SECTION _txCanvas_LockBackBuf = {0,-1}; // Prevent simultaneous access to back buffer, see txLock()
8325
8326UINT_PTR _txCanvas_RefreshTimer = 1; // Timer ID to redraw TXLib window
8327volatile int _txCanvas_RefreshLock = 0; // Blocks auto on-timer canvas update, see txBegin/txEnd
8328
8329::std::vector<HDC>* _txCanvas_UserDCs = NULL; // List of DCs allocated, for auto-free
8330
8331volatile bool _txConsole_IsBlinking = true; // To blink or not to blink, that is the question.
8332
8333int _txConsole = false; // Only first TXLib module in app can own the console
8334bool _txMain = false; // First TXLib wnd opened (closing it terminates program)
8335bool _txIsDll = false; // TXLib module is in DLL
8336volatile bool _txRunning = false; // main() is still running
8337volatile bool _txExit = false; // exit() is active
8338
8339volatile POINT _txMousePos = {-1,-1}; // Ask Captn Obviouos about it. See txCanvas_OnMOUSE()
8340volatile unsigned _txMouseButtons = 0;
8341
8342volatile WNDPROC _txAltWndProc = NULL; // Альтернативная оконная функция. См. txSetWindowsHook().
8343
8344_tx_thread _txLoc _txLoc::Cur = {}; // Execution point tracking and trace state, see "$" macro
8345
8346volatile int _txErrors = 0; // TX_ERROR calls sequental number
8347volatile int _txOGLError = 0; // Last OpenGL error when using tx_glGetError()
8348volatile long _txSENumber = 0; // SEH exceptions sequental number
8349volatile long _txSEFatalNumber = 0; // SEH fatal exceptions sequental number
8350char _txDumpSE [_TX_BUFSIZE] = ""; // SEH dump data area
8351char _txTraceSE[_TX_HUGEBUFSIZE] = ""; // Stack trace data area
8352
8353LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER _txPrevUEFilter = NULL; // Previous UnhandledExceptionFilter
8354
8355jmp_buf _txDumpExceptionObjJmp = {}; // Hook for _txDumpExceptionObj
8356
8357const volatile uintptr_t _txForceImport[] = { (uintptr_t) ::TerminateProcess, (uintptr_t) ::ExitProcess,
8358 (uintptr_t) ::FatalExit, (uintptr_t) ::FatalAppExitA,
8359 (uintptr_t) ::exit, (uintptr_t) Win32::_controlfp,
8360 (uintptr_t) Win32::Polyline, (uintptr_t) Win32::PolyBezier,
8361 (uintptr_t) Win32::RoundRect, (uintptr_t) Win32::RemoveVectoredExceptionHandler,
8362 (uintptr_t) Win32::PlgBlt, (uintptr_t) Win32::RtlCaptureStackBackTrace,
8363 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymInitialize, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymInitialize,
8364 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymSetOptions, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymSetOptions,
8365 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetLineFromAddr64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetLineFromAddr64,
8366 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFromAddr, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFromAddr,
8367 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymCleanup, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymCleanup,
8368 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymGetModuleBase64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymGetModuleBase64,
8369 (uintptr_t) Win32::SymFunctionTableAccess64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::SymFunctionTableAccess64,
8370 (uintptr_t) Win32::StackWalk64, (uintptr_t) Win32::MinGW::StackWalk64,
8371 (uintptr_t) Win32::StrStrIA, (uintptr_t) Win32::Wow64GetThreadContext };
8372
8373volatile unsigned _txCanaryLast = 0x5E2E2E5E; // Another very system value
8374
8375#endif // TX_COMPILED

8378
8379extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryFirst;
8380extern volatile unsigned _txCanaryLast;
8381extern volatile HWND _txCanvas_Window;
8382extern volatile unsigned _txCanvas_ThreadId;

8384extern RGBQUAD* _txCanvas_Pixels;

8392//=================================================================================================================
8393
8394//=================================================================================================================
8395//{ TXLib engine init/check/cleanup
8397//=================================================================================================================
8399
8400//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8401//{ Early initialization
8402//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8403
8404#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
8405
8406int _txInitialize()
8407 {
8408 if (_txInitialized) return 1;
8409 _txInitialized = 1;
8410
8411 #if defined (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK) && defined (_MSC_VER) // See http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/w2fhc9a3%28v=vs.90%29.aspx
8412 _CrtSetBreakAlloc (_TX_ALLOC_BREAK); // and http://support.microsoft.com/ru-ru/kb/151585
8413 #endif
8414
8415 #if defined (_TX_ALLOW_TRACE)
8416 _txLocLvlSet (1);
8417 #endif
8418
8419 _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
8420 OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - The Dumb Artist Library, " _TX_AUTHOR ": \"" __FILE__ "\" "
8421 "compiled " __DATE__ " " __TIME__ ", " _TX_BUILDMODE " mode, module: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
8422 OutputDebugString ("\n"));
8423
8424 _txMainThreadId = GetCurrentThreadId();
8425 _txMainThread = OpenThread (THREAD_ALL_ACCESS, false, _txMainThreadId);
8426
8427$3 _txIsDll = _txInDll();
8428
8429$ if (!_txIsDll)
8430 {
8431$ _txConsole = ! FindAtom ("_txConsole");
8432$ (void) AddAtom ("_txConsole"); //-V530
8433 }
8434
8435$ if (_txConsole)
8436 {
8437$ _txCheckSourceCP (_TX_CODEPAGE, true);
8438
8439$ unsigned long stackSize = _TX_STACKSIZE;
8440$ _TX_CALL (Win32::SetThreadStackGuarantee, (&stackSize));
8441
8442$ _txOnSignal();
8443
8444$ if (!*_txLogName)
8445 {$ _tx_snprintf_s (_txLogName, sizeof (_txLogName) - 1, "%s.log", txGetModuleFileName()); }
8446
8447$ if (!_txIsDll)
8448 {
8449$ _TX_CALL (Win32::AddVectoredExceptionHandler, (1, (PVECTORED_EXCEPTION_HANDLER) _txVectoredExceptionHandler));
8450$ _txPrevUEFilter = SetUnhandledExceptionFilter ( (LPTOP_LEVEL_EXCEPTION_FILTER) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter);
8451 }
8452
8453$ ::std::set_terminate (_txOnTerminate);
8454$ ::std::set_new_handler (_txOnNewHandlerAnsi);
8455$ _TX_CALL (Win32::set_unexpected, (_txOnUnexpected));
8456
8457 #if defined (_CLANG_VER) && !defined (_MSC_VER)
8458$ ::std::__libcpp_debug_function = _txLibCppDebugFunction;
8459 #endif
8460
8461$ SetConsoleCtrlHandler (_txOnConsoleCtrlEvent, true);
8462
8463$ SetErrorMode (SEM_FAILCRITICALERRORS | SEM_NOGPFAULTERRORBOX);
8464
8465 #if defined (_MSC_VER)
8466
8467$ _set_printf_count_output (1);
8468
8469$ _set_new_handler (_txOnNewHandler);
8470$ _set_new_mode (1);
8471
8472 #if !defined (_CLANG_VER)
8473
8474$ _CrtSetDbgFlag (_CRTDBG_ALLOC_MEM_DF | _CRTDBG_CHECK_ALWAYS_DF | _CRTDBG_LEAK_CHECK_DF);
8475$ _CrtSetAllocHook (_txOnAllocHook);
8476
8477$ unsigned mode = _CRTDBG_MODE_FILE;
8478$ if (_CrtSetReportHook2 (_CRT_RPTHOOK_INSTALL, (_CRT_REPORT_HOOK) _txOnErrorReport) > 0) mode = 0;
8479
8480$ _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode);
8481$ _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ERROR, _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
8482$ _CrtSetReportMode (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_MODE_DEBUG | mode | _CRTDBG_MODE_WNDW);
8483$ _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_WARN, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
8484$ _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ERROR, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
8485$ _CrtSetReportFile (_CRT_ASSERT, _CRTDBG_FILE_STDERR);
8486
8487 #endif
8488
8489$ _set_abort_behavior (_WRITE_ABORT_MSG, _WRITE_ABORT_MSG);
8490$ _set_abort_behavior (0, _CALL_REPORTFAULT);
8491
8492$ _RTC_SetErrorFunc (_txOnRTCFailure);
8493$ _set_purecall_handler (_txOnPureCall);
8494$ _set_invalid_parameter_handler (_txOnInvalidParam);
8495
8496 #endif
8497
8498 #if defined (__STDC_LIB_EXT1__)
8499$ ::std::set_constraint_handler_s (_txOnSecurityErrorAnsi);
8500 #endif
8501
8502 #if !defined (__CYGWIN__) && defined (_GCC_VER) && (_GCC_VER >= 530) && !defined (i386)
8503$ __setusermatherr (_txOnMatherr);
8504 #endif
8505
8506 #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
8507$ _set_error_mode (_OUT_TO_MSGBOX | _OUT_TO_STDERR);
8508 #endif
8509
8510$ HWND console = _txConsole_Attach();
8511$ SetWindowTextA (console, txGetModuleFileName (false));
8512 }
8513
8514$ _txSetProcAddress ("ExitProcess", (uintptr_t) _txOnExitProcess, "KERNEL32.DLL");
8515$ _txSetProcAddress ("TerminateProcess", (uintptr_t) _txOnTerminateProcess, "KERNEL32.DLL");
8516$ _txSetProcAddress ("FatalExit", (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalExit, "KERNEL32.DLL");
8517$ _txSetProcAddress ("FatalAppExitA", (uintptr_t) _txOnFatalAppExitA, "KERNEL32.DLL");
8518$ _txSetProcAddress ("UnhandledExceptionFilter", (uintptr_t) _txUnhandledExceptionFilter, "KERNEL32.DLL", true); //-V601
8519$ _txSetProcAddress ("SetUnhandledExceptionFilter", (uintptr_t) _txOnSetUnhandledExceptionFilter, "KERNEL32.DLL");
8520$ _txSetProcAddress ("exit", (uintptr_t) _txOnExit); //???
8521$ _txSetProcAddress ("_cexit", (uintptr_t) _txOnCExit); //???
8522
8523$ InitializeCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf);
8524
8525$ HDC dc = Win32::CreateCompatibleDC (NULL); dc asserted;
8526$ _txStockBitmap = (HBITMAP) Win32::SelectObject (dc, Win32::CreateCompatibleBitmap (dc, 1, 1)); _txStockBitmap asserted;
8527$ Win32::DeleteObject (Win32::SelectObject (dc, _txStockBitmap)) asserted;
8528$ Win32::DeleteDC (dc) asserted;
8529
8530$ atexit (_txCleanup);
8531
8532$ if (_txConsole)
8533 {
8534$ txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
8535
8536$ tx_fpreset();
8537
8538$ srand ((unsigned) time (NULL)); //-V202
8539
8540$ SetLastError (0);
8541$ errno = 0;
8542
8543 #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
8544$ _doserrno = 0;
8545 #endif
8546 }
8547
8548$ return 1;
8549 }
8550
8551//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8552
8553bool _txCheckSourceCP (int needCP /*= _TX_CODEPAGE*/, bool verbose /*= true*/)
8554 {
8555$3 const char* sCodePage = NULL;
8556$ int codePage = 0;
8557
8558$ switch (((unsigned const char*) "А") [0])
8559 {
8560 case 192: {$ codePage = 1251; sCodePage = "1251."; break; }
8561 case 208: {$ codePage = 65001; sCodePage = "UTF-8."; break; }
8562 case 128: {$ codePage = 866; sCodePage = "866."; break; }
8563 case 225: {$ codePage = 20866; sCodePage = "KOI-8, waaat?!"; break; }
8564 default: {$ codePage = -1; sCodePage = "(Unknown)"; break; }
8565 }
8566
8567$ if (codePage != needCP && verbose)
8568 {
8569$ *_txTraceSE = ' '; // No stack trace please
8570
8571$ _TX_UNEXPECTED ("\v\t" "\n\n" "WARNING: CHECK TXLib.h file CODEPAGE. Maybe it is %s It should be %d.\n\n"
8572 "This is NOT an error of TXLib itself. Please note:\n\n"
8573 "Do NOT copy-and-paste TXLib.h file contents into a new file and them save it inside your "
8574 "IDE or editor. This can change original TXLib codepage (%d) to another one. Instead, DO "
8575 "use copy / move / cut-and-paste operations in Windows Explorer (Far Manager etc) only. "
8576 "Or, when you see TXLib.h being opened in browser, use 'Save as...' (Ctrl+S) command.\n\n"
8577 "Now you should re-download TXLib.h file from the http://txlib.ru site.\n\n"
8578 "You can continue, but Russian messages and symbols may appear unreadable.",
8579 sCodePage, needCP, needCP);
8580 }
8581
8582$ return (codePage == needCP);
8583 }
8584
8585//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8586
8587void (*_txDllImport (const char dllFileName[], const char funcName[], bool required /*= true*/)) ()
8588 {
8589 if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (dllFileName && *dllFileName)) return NULL;
8590 if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (funcName && *funcName)) return NULL;
8591
8592 static char dllPaths [2][MAX_PATH] = {"", ""};
8593
8594 if (!*dllPaths[0])
8595 {
8596 const char dllDir[] = "\\Windows\\";
8597
8598 // dllPaths[0] is relative to the TX Setup directory stored in the Registry
8599
8600 char* path = dllPaths[0];
8601
8602 txRegQuery ("HKCU\\Software\\TX Library", "ProductDir", path, MAX_PATH);
8603 strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
8604
8605 // dllPaths[1] is relative to TXib.h file used in compilation
8606
8607 path = dllPaths[1];
8608
8609 if (strchr (__FILE__, ':'))
8610 {
8611 strncpy_s (path, MAX_PATH, __FILE__, sizeof (__FILE__) - 1);
8612 }
8613 else
8614 {
8615 GetCurrentDirectory (MAX_PATH, path);
8616 strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, "\\" __FILE__, sizeof ("\\" __FILE__) - 1);
8617 }
8618
8619 if (char* dir = strrchr (path, '\\')) *dir = 0;
8620
8621 strncat_s (path, MAX_PATH, dllDir, sizeof (dllDir) - 1);
8622 }
8623
8624 char dllName[MAX_PATH] = "", dllArch[MAX_PATH] = "";
8625 const char* arch = (dllFileName? strchr (dllFileName, '*') : NULL); //-V547
8626
8627 if (arch)
8628 {
8629 assert (arch >= dllFileName); //-V547
8630
8631 strncpy_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
8632 strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), arch+1, sizeof (dllName) - 1 - strlen (dllName));
8633
8634 strncpy_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), dllFileName, (size_t) (arch - dllFileName));
8635 strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), sizeof (void*) == 8? "64" : "32", 3);
8636 strncat_s (dllArch, sizeof (dllArch), arch+1, sizeof (dllArch) - 1 - strlen (dllArch));
8637 }
8638 else if (dllFileName) //-V547 //-V2516
8639 {
8640 strncat_s (dllName, sizeof (dllName), dllFileName, sizeof (dllName) - 1);
8641 }
8642
8643 HMODULE dll = GetModuleHandle (dllFileName);
8644
8645 if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllArch);
8646 if (!dll) dll = GetModuleHandle (dllName);
8647
8648 for (int i = 0; !dll && i < (int) sizearr (dllPaths); i++)
8649 {
8650 char path [MAX_PATH] = "";
8651 strncpy_s (path, sizeof (path), dllPaths[i], sizeof (dllPaths[i]));
8652 size_t len = strlen (path);
8653
8654 strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllArch, sizeof (dllArch));
8655 if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path); //-V547
8656
8657 strncpy_s (path + len, sizeof (path) - len, dllName, sizeof (dllName));
8658 if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (path);
8659 }
8660
8661 if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllArch);
8662 if (!dll) dll = LoadLibrary (dllName);
8663
8664 if (!dll && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot load library \"%s%s%s\".",
8665 dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
8666 if (!dll) return NULL;
8667
8668 void (*addr)() = (void(*)()) GetProcAddress (dll, funcName);
8669
8670 if (!addr && required) TX_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot import \"%s\" from library \"%s%s%s\".",
8671 funcName, dllName, (arch? "\" / \"" : ""), dllArch);
8672 return addr;
8673 }
8674
8675//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8676
8677#if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800) // MSVC 2013
8678 #pragma warning (push)
8679 #pragma warning (disable: 6102) // Использование 'name' из завершившегося ошибкой вызова функции
8680#endif
8681
8682int txRegQuery (const char* keyName, const char* valueName, void* value, size_t szValue)
8683 {
8684 if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (keyName)) return 0;
8685
8686 HKEY hive = NULL;
8687
8688 #define EQU_(name1, name2) ( _strnicmp (keyName, name1 "\\", sizeof (name1)) == 0 || \
8689 _strnicmp (keyName, name2 "\\", sizeof (name2)) == 0 )
8690
8691 if (EQU_("HKLM", "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE")) hive = HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE;
8692 else if (EQU_("HKCU", "HKEY_CURRENT_USER")) hive = HKEY_CURRENT_USER;
8693 else if (EQU_("HKCR", "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT")) hive = HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT;
8694 else if (EQU_("HKU", "HKEY_USERS")) hive = HKEY_USERS;
8695 else if (EQU_("HKCC", "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG")) hive = HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG;
8696
8697 else { _TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (("keyName должно начинаться с HKLM\\, HKCU\\, HKCR\\, HKU\\ или HKCC\\ ", hive)); return 0; }
8698
8699 #undef EQU_
8700
8701 keyName = strchr (keyName, '\\') + 1; //-V769
8702 assert (keyName > (const char*) 1);
8703
8704 HKEY key = NULL;
8705 DWORD size = 0;
8706
8707 bool ok = (RegOpenKeyEx (hive, keyName, 0, KEY_QUERY_VALUE, &key) == ERROR_SUCCESS);
8708 if (ok) ok &= (RegQueryValueEx (key, valueName, NULL, NULL, NULL, &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS);
8709 if (ok && value && size < szValue) ok &= (RegQueryValueEx (key, valueName, NULL, NULL, (BYTE*) value, &size) == ERROR_SUCCESS); //-V104
8710 if (key) ok &= (RegCloseKey (key) == ERROR_SUCCESS);
8711
8712 return size;
8713 }
8714
8715#if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER == 1800)
8716 #pragma warning (pop)
8717#endif
8718
8719#endif // TX_COMPILED
8720
8721//}
8722//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8723
8724#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
8725
8726HWND txCreateWindow (double sizeX, double sizeY, bool centered /*= true*/)
8727 {
8728$1 if (!_txInitialized) _txInitialized = _txInitialize();
8729
8730$ if (HWND wnd = txWindow())
8731 {
8732$ SetLastErrorEx (ERROR_INVALID_DATA, 0);
8733$ _TX_ON_DEBUG (TX_ERROR ("\a" "Окно рисования уже создано!"));
8734$ return wnd;
8735 }
8736
8737$ if (!_txIsDll)
8738 {
8739$ _txMain = ! FindAtom ("_txMain"); // Not a thread-safe
8740$ (void) AddAtom ("_txMain"); //-V530
8741 }
8742
8743$ if (_txWindowUpdateInterval < 10) {$ _txWindowUpdateInterval = 10; } //-V1048
8744
8745$ _txRunning = false;
8746
8747 // Store the size
8748
8749$ static SIZE size = { ROUND (sizeX), ROUND (sizeY) };
8750$ if (centered) { size.cx *= -1; size.cy *= -1; }
8751
8752 // In Thread, where REAL creation lies...
8753
8754$ unsigned id = 0;
8755$ _txCanvas_Thread = (HANDLE) Win32::_beginthreadex (NULL, 0, _txCanvas_ThreadProc, &size, 0, &id);
8756
8757$ if (!_txCanvas_Thread) return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot start canvas thread."), (HWND) NULL;
8758
8759$ _txWaitFor (_txRunning, 10*_TX_TIMEOUT);
8760
8761$ if (!_txRunning) return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Cannot create canvas window."), (HWND) NULL;
8762$ if (!txOK()) return TX_DEBUG_ERROR ("\a" "Canvas window is not OK."), (HWND) NULL;
8763
8764$ HWND console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
8765
8766$ DWORD proc = 0;
8767$ GetWindowThreadProcessId (console, &proc);
8768
8769$ if (console && (proc == GetCurrentProcessId() || _txIsParentWaitable()))
8770 {$ ShowWindow (console, TX_CONSOLE_MODE); }
8771
8772$ HMENU menu = GetSystemMenu (txWindow(), false);
8773 if (menu) {$ CheckMenuItem (menu, _TX_IDM_CONSOLE, (console? (IsWindowVisible (console)? MF_CHECKED : 0) : MF_DISABLED)); }
8774
8775$ Win32::GdiSetBatchLimit (1);
8776
8777$ SetLastError (0);
8778
8779$ errno = 0;
8780
8781 #if !defined (__CYGWIN__)
8782$ _doserrno = 0;
8783 #endif
8784
8785$ return txWindow();
8786 }
8787
8788//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8789
8790HWND txCreateExtraWindow (CREATESTRUCT createData)
8791 {
8792$1 if (_TX_TXWINDOW_FAILED()) return NULL;
8793
8794$ volatile HWND wnd = NULL;
8795$ createData.hInstance = (HINSTANCE)(uintptr_t) &wnd;
8796
8797$ PostMessage (txWindow(), _TX_WM_CREATEWND, 0, (LPARAM) &createData) asserted;
8798
8799$ _txWaitFor (wnd, 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
8800
8801$ return wnd;
8802 }
8803
8804//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8805
8806bool txSetDefaults (HDC dc /*= txDC()*/)
8807 {
8808$1 if (dc == txDC()) txUpdateWindow (false); //-V601
8809$ txAutoLock _lock;
8810
8811$ RECT r = {};
8812$ GetClientRect (Win32::GetConsoleWindow(), &r);
8813$ SIZE szCon = { r.right - r.left, r.bottom - r.top };
8814
8815$ HANDLE out = GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE);
8816
8817$ CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {{80, 25}, {}, 0, {0, 0, 80-1, 25-1}, {80, 25}};
8818$ GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (out, &con);
8819
8820$ SIZE szTxt = { (short) (con.srWindow.Right - con.srWindow.Left + 1),
8821 (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom - con.srWindow.Top + 1) };
8822
8823//{ Set defaults for graphics layer
8824
8825$ _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_PEN), dc) asserted;
8826$ _txBuffer_Select (Win32::GetStockObject (WHITE_BRUSH), dc) asserted;
8827
8828$ _txBuffer_Select (Win32::CreateFont (szCon.cy/szTxt.cy, szCon.cx/szTxt.cx,
8829 0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
8830 RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
8831 DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, TX_CONSOLE_FONT),
8832 dc) asserted;
8833
8834$ (Win32::SetTextColor (dc, TX_WHITE) != CLR_INVALID) asserted;
8835$ Win32::SetBkMode (dc, TRANSPARENT) asserted;
8836
8837$ Win32::SetROP2 (dc, R2_COPYPEN) asserted;
8838$ Win32::SetStretchBltMode (dc, HALFTONE) asserted;
8839
8840//}
8841
8842$ if (dc != txDC())
8843 {$ return true; }
8844
8845//{ Set defaults for console layer
8846
8847$ POINT szCanvas = txGetExtent (dc);
8848
8849$ HGDIOBJ font = txFontExist (TX_CONSOLE_FONT)?
8850 Win32::CreateFont (szCanvas.y/szTxt.cy, szCanvas.x/szTxt.cx,
8851 0, 0, FW_REGULAR, FALSE, FALSE, FALSE,
8852 RUSSIAN_CHARSET, OUT_DEFAULT_PRECIS, CLIP_DEFAULT_PRECIS,
8853 DEFAULT_QUALITY, FIXED_PITCH, TX_CONSOLE_FONT)
8854 :
8855 Win32::GetStockObject (SYSTEM_FIXED_FONT);
8856
8857$ _txBuffer_Select (font, _txCanvas_BackBuf[1]);
8858//}
8859
8860//{ Scroll the console for text to go above top of window and don't mix with graphics
8861
8862$ if (con.dwCursorPosition.X) _putch ('\n');
8863
8864$ short delta = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - con.srWindow.Top);
8865
8866$ con.srWindow.Top = (short) (con.srWindow.Top + delta);
8867$ con.srWindow.Bottom = (short) (con.srWindow.Bottom + delta);
8868
8869$ SMALL_RECT src = { 0, 0, (short) (con.dwSize.X - 1), (short) (con.dwSize.Y - 1) };
8870$ CHAR_INFO fill = { {' '}, FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY };
8871$ COORD dest = { 0, (short) -delta }; // New UL-corner of src, scroll up
8872
8873$ con.dwCursorPosition.X = 0;
8874$ con.dwCursorPosition.Y = (short) (con.dwCursorPosition.Y - delta);
8875
8876$ (con.srWindow.Bottom < con.dwSize.Y && // Move the "window"
8877 SetConsoleWindowInfo (out, true, &con.srWindow))
8878 ||
8879 (ScrollConsoleScreenBuffer (out, &src, NULL, dest, &fill), // Or scroll the buffer
8880 SetConsoleCursorPosition (out, con.dwCursorPosition));
8881//}
8882
8883$ txUpdateWindow (true); //-V601
8884
8885 return true;
8886 }
8887
8888#endif // TX_COMPILED
8889
8890//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8891
8892inline bool txOK()
8893 {
8894 return (_txCanaryFirst == 0x776F656D && // Too well-known values to use constants. You know these values, don't you?
8895 _txCanaryLast == 0x5E2E2E5E &&
8896 _txCanvas_OK()
8897
8898 #if defined (_MSC_VER)
8899 && _CrtCheckMemory()
8900 #endif
8901 );
8902 }
8903
8904//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8905//{ Cleanup
8906//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8907
8908#ifndef TX_COMPILED // <<< THE CODE IS HERE, UNFOLD IT <<<
8909
8910// Implicit std(MSVCRT.dll)::_cexit() call before _txCleanup can lead to hangs in _cexit handlers chain.
8911// So redefining ::std::_cexit(). Do it dynamically via PE Import Table hook to avoid duplicate symbols
8912// if several modules linked together include TXLib.h. See _txSetProcAddress() call in _txInitialize().
8913
8914void _txOnCExit()
8915 {
8916 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8917
8918$5 _txCleanup();
8919
8920 _TX_CALLv (Win32::_cexit, ());
8921 }
8922
8923//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8924
8925void _txOnExit (int retcode)
8926 {
8927 if (retcode != 0)
8928 {
8929 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8930 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
8931 }
8932
8933$5 _txCleanup();
8934
8935 if (retcode != 0)
8936 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::exit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
8937
8938 Win32::exit (retcode);
8939 }
8940
8941//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8942
8943void _txOnExitProcess (unsigned retcode)
8944 {
8945 if (retcode != 0)
8946 {
8947 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8948 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
8949 }
8950
8951$5 _txCleanup();
8952
8953 if (retcode != 0)
8954 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::ExitProcess (%u)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
8955
8956 Win32::ExitProcess (retcode);
8957 }
8958
8959//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8960
8961bool _txOnTerminateProcess (HANDLE process, unsigned retcode)
8962 {
8963 if (retcode != 0)
8964 {
8965 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8966 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%p, %u) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, process, retcode);
8967 }
8968
8969$5 _txCleanup();
8970
8971 if (retcode != 0)
8972 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::TerminateProcess (0x%p, %u)\n", _TX_VERSION, process, retcode);
8973
8974 return Win32::TerminateProcess (process, retcode);
8975 }
8976
8977//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8978
8979void _txOnFatalExit (int retcode)
8980 {
8981 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8982 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%d) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, retcode);
8983
8984$5 _txCleanup();
8985
8986 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalExit (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
8987 _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalExit, (retcode));
8988
8989 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (%d)\n", _TX_VERSION, retcode);
8990 Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), retcode);
8991 }
8992
8993//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
8994
8995void _txOnFatalAppExitA (unsigned action, const char message[])
8996 {
8997 OutputDebugString ("\n");
8998 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (%u, \"%s\") called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, action, message);
8999
9000$5 _txCleanup();
9001
9002 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: calling Win32::FatalAppExitA (%u, %s)\n", _TX_VERSION, action, message);
9003 _TX_CALLv (Win32::FatalAppExitA, (action, message));
9004
9005 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: Win32::FatalExit() failure, calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION);
9006 Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
9007 }
9008
9009//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9010
9011BOOL WINAPI _txOnConsoleCtrlEvent (DWORD type)
9012 {
9013 OutputDebugString ("\n");
9014 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s (0x%04lX) called\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) type);
9015
9016$5 switch (type)
9017 {
9018 case CTRL_LOGOFF_EVENT:
9019 case CTRL_SHUTDOWN_EVENT: $ _txExit = true;
9020 $ _txCleanup();
9021 case CTRL_C_EVENT:
9022 case CTRL_CLOSE_EVENT:
9023 case CTRL_BREAK_EVENT:
9024
9025 default: break; //-V2522
9026 }
9027
9028$ return false;
9029 }
9030
9031//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9032
9033void _txCleanup()
9034 {
9035 if (!_txInitialized) return;
9036 else _txInitialized = false; //-V601
9037
9038$3 _txRunning = false;
9039$ _txConsole_IsBlinking = false;
9040
9041$ txSetProgress (100, (!_txErrors)? Win32::TBPF_PAUSED : Win32::TBPF_ERROR);
9042
9043$ txSetWindowsHook (NULL);
9044
9045$ HWND canvas = txWindow();
9046$ HWND console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
9047$ unsigned thread = GetCurrentThreadId();
9048
9049$ HWND wnd = (canvas)? canvas : console;
9050
9051$ bool externTerm = (thread != _txMainThreadId &&
9052 thread != _txCanvas_ThreadId);
9053$ DWORD parent = 0;
9054$ int isParentWaitable = _txIsParentWaitable (&parent);
9055$ bool waitableParent = !externTerm && isParentWaitable;
9056
9057$ if (canvas)
9058 {$ txSleep (5*_txWindowUpdateInterval); }
9059
9060$ if (_txConsole)
9061 {
9062$ if (_txMain) txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
9063
9064$ if (console)
9065 {
9066$ EnableWindow (console, true);
9067$ _txSetFinishedText (console);
9068 }
9069 }
9070
9071$ if (_txMain && !externTerm && canvas)
9072 {$ _txSetFinishedText (canvas); }
9073
9074$ std::cout.flush();
9075$ std::cerr.flush();
9076$ std::clog.flush();
9077$ _flushall();
9078
9079$ bool paused = false;
9080$ if (((canvas? _txMain : _txConsole) && !_txExit) || (_txErrors && thread == _txMainThreadId))
9081 {
9082$ if (wnd)
9083 {
9084$ if (isParentWaitable >= 0)
9085 {$ _txActivateWindow (wnd, 0x0A); }
9086
9087$ EnableWindow (wnd, true);
9088 }
9089
9090$ if (console && isParentWaitable >= 0)
9091 {
9092$ _txPauseBeforeTermination (canvas);
9093$ paused = true;
9094 }
9095 }
9096
9097$ if (_txWatchdogTimeout >= 0)
9098 {$ Win32::_beginthread (_txWatchdogTerminator, 0, &_txWatchdogTimeout); }
9099
9100$ if (txWindow())
9101 {$ SendNotifyMessage (txWindow(), WM_DESTROY, 0, 0); }
9102
9103$ _txWaitFor (!txWindow(), 5*_TX_TIMEOUT);
9104
9105$ txSpeak (NULL);
9106$ txPlayVideo (NULL);
9107
9108$ delete _txCanvas_UserDCs;
9109$ _txCanvas_UserDCs = NULL;
9110
9111$ if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txMainThreadId)
9112 {$ SuspendThread (_txMainThread); } //-V720
9113$ if (GetCurrentThreadId() != _txCanvas_ThreadId)
9114 {$ SuspendThread (_txCanvas_Thread); } //-V720
9115
9116$ if (_txMainThread)
9117 {$ CloseHandle (_txMainThread) asserted; _txMainThread = NULL; }
9118$ if (_txCanvas_Thread)
9119 {$ CloseHandle (_txCanvas_Thread) asserted; _txCanvas_Thread = NULL; }
9120
9121$ if (!txWindow())
9122 {$ DeleteCriticalSection (&_txCanvas_LockBackBuf); CRITICAL_SECTION zero = {0, -1}; _txCanvas_LockBackBuf = zero; }
9123
9124$ bool parentKilled = false;
9125$ if (waitableParent && paused && _txNOP (_TX_ALLOW_KILL_PARENT))
9126 {
9127$ console = Win32::GetConsoleWindow();
9128
9129$ parentKilled = _txKillProcess (parent);
9130
9131$ if (!parentKilled)
9132 {
9133$ PostMessage (console, WM_KEYDOWN, VK_RETURN, 0x001C0001); // Scancode = 0x1C, Count = 1
9134$ PostMessage (console, WM_KEYUP, VK_RETURN, 0xC01C0001); // Scancode = 0x1C, Count = 1, Prev = 1, Trans = 1
9135 }
9136 }
9137
9138$ if (_txMain && _txConsole)
9139 {$ _txConsole_Detach (waitableParent && !parentKilled && !externTerm); } //-V560
9140
9141$ std::cout.flush();
9142$ std::cerr.flush();
9143$ std::clog.flush();
9144$ _flushall();
9145
9146$ _txSymGetFromAddr (NULL);
9147
9148 // That's all, folks
9149
9150 _TX_ON_DEBUG (OutputDebugString ("\n");
9151 OutputDebugString (_TX_VERSION " - FINISHED: " _TX_MODULE "\n");
9152 OutputDebugString ("\n"));
9153 }
9154
9155//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9156
9157int _txSetFinishedText (HWND wnd)
9158 {
9159 struct tools
9160 {
9161 static LRESULT getWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[], size_t size)
9162 {
9163$3 memset (text, 0, size * sizeof (*text));
9164
9165$ return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_GETTEXT, (WPARAM) size, (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
9166 }
9167
9168 static LRESULT setWindowText (HWND window, wchar_t text[])
9169 {
9170$1 return SendMessageTimeoutW (window, WM_SETTEXT, 0, (LPARAM) text, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL);
9171 }
9172 };
9173
9174$1 static wchar_t title [_TX_BUFSIZE+15] = L"TXLib";
9175
9176$ tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
9177$ int len = (int) wcslen (title); if (len >= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE) len = _TX_BUFSIZE-1;
9178
9179$ MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [ЗАВЕРШЕНО]", -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
9180
9181$ tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
9182$ tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
9183$ if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == (wchar_t) 0x0417 /* 'З' */) return 0;
9184
9185$ MultiByteToWideChar (_TX_CODEPAGE, 0, " [FINISHED]", -1, title + len, (int)_TX_BUFSIZE - len);
9186
9187$ tools::setWindowText (wnd, title);
9188$ tools::getWindowText (wnd, title, _TX_BUFSIZE-1);
9189$ if (len <= (int)_TX_BUFSIZE-1-2 && title [len+2] == /* 'F' */ (wchar_t) 0x0046) return 1;
9190
9191$ return 2;
9192 }
9193
9194//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9195
9196void _txPauseBeforeTermination (HWND canvas)
9197 {
9198$3 while (_kbhit()) (void)_getch();
9199
9200$ CONSOLE_SCREEN_BUFFER_INFO con = {};
9201$ bool kbRedir = !GetConsoleScreenBufferInfo (GetStdHandle (STD_OUTPUT_HANDLE), &con);
9202$ bool kbWait = (_txGetInput() == EOF);
9203$ bool wine = !!Win32::wine_get_version;
9204
9205$ txSetLocale();
9206$ int attr = txSetConsoleAttr (FOREGROUND_LIGHTGRAY);
9207
9208$ Win32::FLASHWINFO flash = { sizeof (flash), txWindow(), FLASHW_ALL | FLASHW_TIMERNOFG, 0xFFFFFFFF };
9209$ _TX_CALL (Win32::FlashWindowEx, (&flash));
9210
9211$ if (kbWait && !kbRedir && !wine)
9212 {
9213$ if (!_txErrors)
9214 {
9215$ if (!canvas)
9216 {$ fprintf (stderr, "\n" "[Нажмите любую клавишу для завершения]"); }
9217 }
9218 else
9219 {
9220$ fprintf (stderr, "\n" "[Press F to Pay Respects...]"); // https://knowyourmeme.com/memes/press-f-to-pay-respects
9221 }
9222
9223$ fflush (stderr);
9224$ txSleep();
9225 }
9226
9227$ for (int i = 1; ; i++) //-V2530
9228 {
9229$ Sleep (_txWindowUpdateInterval);
9230
9231 if (!kbWait || (kbRedir && !canvas)) {$ break; } // No need to run and hide
9232
9233 if (!wine && _txGetInput() != EOF) {$ break; } // Somebody hit something.
9234
9235 if (canvas && !_txCanvas_ThreadId) {$ break; } // There was a window, and now there is not.
9236
9237 if (!Win32::GetConsoleWindow()) {$ break; } // Console was destroyed
9238
9239 if (_TX_CALL (Win32::GhostWindowFromHungWindow, (canvas)))
9240 {$ TX_ERROR ("Программа зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
9241
9242 if (canvas && _TX_CALL (Win32::IsHungAppWindow, (canvas)))
9243 {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа-таки зависла и будет завершена."); break; }
9244
9245 if (canvas && !SendMessageTimeout (canvas, WM_NULL, 0,0, SMTO_BLOCK | SMTO_ABORTIFHUNG, _TX_TIMEOUT, NULL))
9246 {$ _txTrace (__FILE__, __LINE__, NULL, "WARNING: Программа не отвечает и будет завершена."); break; }
9247
9248 if (!wine && !(i % 100500))
9249 {$ fprintf (stderr, "\r" "[Так нажмите же какую-нибудь клавишу для моего завершения]"); }
9250 }
9251
9252$ while (!wine && _kbhit()) (void)_getch();
9253
9254$ txSetConsoleAttr (attr);
9255$ fprintf (stderr, "\n\n");
9256 }
9257
9258//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9259
9260int _txGetInput()
9261 {
9262$4 HANDLE con = GetStdHandle (STD_INPUT_HANDLE);
9263
9264$ DWORD nChars = 0;
9265$ if (GetConsoleMode (con, &nChars) == 0 &&
9266 PeekNamedPipe (con, NULL, 0, NULL, &nChars, NULL))
9267 {
9268$ return (nChars)? fgetc (stdin) : EOF;
9269 }
9270
9271$ if (_kbhit())
9272 {
9273$ return _getch();
9274 }
9275
9276#if defined (_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER < 1700)
9277
9278$ if (fseek (stdin, 1, SEEK_CUR) != EOF)
9279 {
9280$ (void) fseek (stdin, -1, SEEK_CUR);
9281$ return fgetc (stdin); // This causes blocking in MSVC 2011 beta
9282 }
9283
9284#endif
9285
9286$ return EOF;
9287 }
9288
9289//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9290
9291int _txIsParentWaitable (DWORD* parentPID /*= NULL*/)
9292 {
9293$4 PROCESSENTRY32* info = _txFindProcess();
9294$ if (!info) return 0;
9295
9296$ info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID);
9297$ if (!info) return 0;
9298
9299$ char parent [MAX_PATH] = "";
9300$ strncpy_s (parent, sizeof (parent), info->szExeFile, sizeof (parent) - 1);
9301$ if (parentPID) *parentPID = info->th32ProcessID;
9302
9303$ info = _txFindProcess (info->th32ParentProcessID); // info: grandparent
9304
9305$ char list[_TX_BUFSIZE] = _TX_WAITABLE_PARENTS;
9306$ char* ctx = NULL;
9307
9308$ for (char* p = strtok_s (list, ", ", &ctx); p; p = strtok_s (NULL, ", ", &ctx))
9309 {
9310$ char* gp = strchr (p, ':');
9311
9312$ if (gp)
9313 {
9314$ *gp++ = 0;
9315
9316$ if (_stricmp (p, parent) != 0) { continue; }
9317
9318$ if (info) if (_stricmp (gp, info->szExeFile) == 0) // Was &&, but MSVC /analyze is so paranoid
9319 {$ return islower ((unsigned char) *gp)? +1 : -1; }
9320 }
9321 else
9322 {
9323$ if (_stricmp (p, parent) == 0)
9324 {$ return islower ((unsigned char) *p)? +1 : -1; }
9325 }
9326 }
9327
9328$ return 0;
9329 }
9330
9331//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
9332
9333void _txWatchdogTerminator (void* timeout) // Or Watchcat? Possibly will change in future versions
9334 {
9335$3 if (_TX_ARGUMENT_FAILED (timeout)) return;
9336
9337$ Sleep (*(int*) timeout); //-V206
9338
9339$ OutputDebugString ("\n");
9340 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Timeout (%d) expired, activating. %s\n", // Kinda static reflection...
9341 _TX_VERSION, __func__, *(int*) timeout, ((__func__[8] == 'd')? "Bark, bark" : "Meow, meow")); //-V206
9342$ DWORD parent = 0;
9343$ if (_txIsParentWaitable (&parent))
9344 {
9345 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling _txKillProcess (0x%04lu)\n",
9346 _TX_VERSION, __func__, (unsigned long) parent);
9347
9348$ _txKillProcess (parent);
9349
9350$ HWND console = GetConsoleWindow();
9351$ PostMessage (console, WM_KEYDOWN, VK_RETURN, 0x001C0001); // Scancode = 0x1C, Count = 1
9352$ PostMessage (console, WM_KEYUP, VK_RETURN, 0xC01C0001); // Scancode = 0x1C, Count = 1, Prev = 1, Trans = 1
9353 }
9354
9355 txOutputDebugPrintf ("%s - WARNING: %s(): Calling Win32::TerminateProcess (EXIT_FAILURE)\n", _TX_VERSION, __func__);
9356$ Win32::TerminateProcess (GetCurrentProcess(), EXIT_FAILURE);
9357 }
9358
9359#endif // TX_COMPILED
9360
